zqSkZYpnIF2A9X9GXiSC2A.text: Fez is a charming, quirky eclectic little restaurant that seems to do everything right. The wait staff are young, tattooed, 'interesting' and very good at their jobs. Our waitress, Candace, was one of the best servers I've seen in awhile. She was friendly, gave great recommendations and after my husband asked for '399' olives in his Gin Martini, she brought a whole spear's worth plus extra. I had a Kentucky Mule (not their name for it) and it was wonderful. The menu is extensive with something for everyone. I ordered the curry with shrimp ( you have an option of 4 or 8- 4 shrimp are plenty) and it was absolutely delicious. My husband ordered a beef dish that was tender and nicely seasoned. Service was great- we never needed to ask for water or anything. My friend had wine and the pours were generous. Good beer and spirits selection. We ordered Tiramasu for dessert and it was probably the weakest link- kind of ice creamy and not enough cocoa. Not bad- just not as good as the rest of the meal. For old folks from Chandler it was great to go to a young hip restaurant that has old school class and well trained staff. Special thanks to Candace for making it a great night- we'll be back. PS- she should get a raise- a great face for the restaurant.

CBCPnUzmO1vIkE80DxKimA.text: I love Fez. Brunch is our favorite meal to enjoy there. The service has always been great.

9QkDOftbqqsgVQL5VFJM1g.text: I've been a fan but tonight I was unimpressed. We got the bruschetta to begin and one of the varieties was supposed to be dates, nuts, and mascarpone. What we got had a very sweet, pink cream, almost like strawberry cream cheese. It was way too sweet and tasted weird. No where in the menu does it say a berry mascarpone, so that was strange. I've had the bruschetta before with the mascarpone and it was quite different, much lighter.  The mozarella on the other variety was very good though. Then we got the spice road chicken to split, with fries, which comes out to about  $16 when you count the charge for a split plate and adding fries. That's fine, we knew about it from reading the menu. The fries are sup par, nothing to rave about, and not worth the upcharge. I was looking forward to trying something new, but was disappointed. our sandwich had deep fried slices of chicken no thicker than 1/2 cm. I'm not kidding! I've never seen chicken sliced that thin. It was like they took a deli slice and deep fried it. It was certainly not worth the money. I wouldn't have paid more tab  $7 for what we got.  We mentioned our concerns and the waiters response was "well its deep fried". He was quite sassy and seemed offended at first. I hate sending things back! It is not something I do frequently and the response we were given made me feel very guilty, but the fact of the matter is there was just no meat on that sandwich! They did offer to get us a different item, we requested to get the fez burger instead and that was decent, not nearly as good as the old location. We have been long time supporters, my boyfriend and I, but we are noticing that the quality is declining. For as much as the meals cost, we hope you improve soon! We won't be returning for a while.

ipZXlcHFg2xIalZmt-GVtQ.text: Loved the food here. The drinks are great and reasonably priced and the french fries were amazing! has an awesome vibe!

WTb-c-t6k6LeyNKyJ08dDQ.text: Absolutely love this place. The food was delicious! The staff was friendly and accommodating to our group that started at 3 and turned into 7. We enjoyed our time at Fez and will be back very soon.

0ye_tFkv_29_GLi4n64Bvw.text: Great food and service. We made reservations for brunch Saturday and were very pleased! We will definitely be back.

ssKWPWcWeq4RAixGWPKIVw.text: The only thing that saves this place is the ambience and the food. I've been here twice in the last couple of weeks. The service is ridiculously slow and it seems the servers think their aesthetics will somehow overcompensate for lackluster accommodations. My friend and I waited 55 minutes for a round and a half of drinks and tortilla chips, salsa and guacamole. We asked twice what the hold up was with the chips, at which the server said it just takes some time to prepare them.  Bottom Line---Great Food, Super Slow Service.

Ih748cGwGLQu9q_IfbJ0rg.text: Great food and even better service. The nachos are huge and good. But the Mac and cheese is even better. It's not on the menu, but it's delicious! The portions are very large, so expect to take leftovers home. There's a great variety of drinks too! And they happy hour every day.

NV7WbR1ruOj_T1G42JfW-g.text: Excellent!  I love the new location.  I had dinner on the patio last weekend and it could not be more pleasant.  I like it so much better than the old location on Central.  The menu is good.  I had a gyro kisra and it was great.  I don't eat a lot so I took half of it home and it was great the next day, too.  The service was good, too.  Our waiter was a very friendly young man who took great care of us.   I will go here more often because of the new location.

zkUBy6T3qE85nbKiumrZOQ.text: The cocktail list here verges on "sorority drinks" (all sugar, no finesse) but manages to stay one step above.  My donkey punch was delicious and I can safely say it's the most pleasurable donkey punch I've ever had.  ;)    Timing on the food was a bit off as we ordered fries for an appetizer and they actually came after the meal.  The patio is a great place to people-watch and I didn't find the road noise off-putting (I often do).

V9h-ww5NZeHO2-iDaeg7Uw.text: I had a terrible experience here on 2/8/2107. First of all I'm pretty sure the bar is way understaffed or staffed with in incompetent bartender. The bar back and food runner was more attentive than the bar tender.  I got drinks on a, I'll help you when I can help you basis, but the order wasn't what I ordered at all. A professional restaurant would have a drinks bartender and a bar bartender on staff- no excuses! This is FEZ management and ownership's problem.  I also asked about the wifi, which wasn't working (to be refreshed) and in over an hour no one helped me. The bartender looked closely at the problem and assured that he'd get someone to refresh the non-existent network. DON'T EXPECT TO DO ANY KIND OF WORK, WORK FUNCTION, OR EVENT NEEDING WI-FI HERE!  Things would be cool if in an hour he even acknowledged there's nothing that could be done. As for my meal- I let them know it wasn't what I ordered or expected and was told "maybe just consider this your cheat day." Really?   This place is supposed to be "Gay owned and operated" but they have no restaurant class... haha. Ya'd think they at least have restaurant class. 1 Star Review which is rare for me!!!!  I haven't seen any gay owners inside here in my visits. It is centrally located, sure! But much better choices within walking distance before you walk into this place.   #ShitofPhoenix  #don'tgohere  #phoenix  #gayresturant "quote"  #shittyplaces  #terribleAz  #

4nPZHYwXLrJQ19am6KDB0A.text: Came here while visiting Phoenix and had a great experience. The food was good and made well with healthy ingredients, but the service is what really earned the stars. The owner always remembers my friend when she comes in and makes her feel special. Our server was so awesome as well....super attentive and genuinely caring and interested in us having a great experience.

lc8Xj7UKSSOlAOvwSAJhvQ.text: I love hip and trendy places, and this was defiantly that. The experience here was great! Our waitress was very helpful and went through the entire menu describing her favorite dishes to us.   We got a plate of nachos for the table, some rosemary fries and sweet potato fries. The sweet potato fries came with an apricot aioli sauce, and it was fantastic!  For the main entree I got a hummus burger (can't recall the actual menu name). The burger itself was tasty, but could have used some more seasoning. Possibly salt? Other than the that it was very tasty.  For dessert I had a chocolate martini, and it's probably one of the best I've had.   The only "complaint", and I use that word lightly, would be waiting for our server. The restaurant wasn't very busy, but it still took forever to get refills on water. It looked like she was the only waitress working, so it wasn't her fault I'm sure.   If you're looking for a hip and trendy place that supports the local restaurant and bar scene, Fez is the place to go!

EE7AVAuuBk5hOKum2mKGfg.text: Never have I had such poor services. If I could provide a zero I would.  First I took it as just being busy, but when your waiter takes your water drink and never come back that's not busy.  This is a business and you should all have on goal making sure everyone is served.  When yo can fill different table drinks and not once acknowledge, the table in the back when clearly you see no drinks, or food on the table just how you took time to pick plates until off a table, you're could have come over and at least say sorry have you been help, give me one moment and I'll be right with you. Mind you the original waiter is at the bar talking.  we have now been here 20mins with two kids at the table, my brother had to get up to find out what was going on. Just to be told one moment, just so you can help the next guess coming in mind you we have been here for 20 mins. So we just left just in time for our waiter to realize he forgot his table.

1d3FrMqfcG1bW5XFrmocqQ.text: Our server was the worst! She seriously looksd miserable. The girl had blue hair and if you ever go to fez make sure you avoid her. She not onced asked about how our food was or offer more drinks we had to keep asking other servers to please help us. I almost didn't leave her a tip but I felt bad. Seriously so disappointed with this place. Fez needs to be better with their customer service very disappointing when you actually like the food but threat the service.

7TkEg-_xxgjIPSfkZ9pJdw.text: Picked this place as it was close to the Phoenix Theater. Had never heard if it. In a trendy area of Phoenix. My husband and I shared the salmon dish. It was delicious. Very flavorful. Attentive staff. Attractive decor. Outside seating available. We came on a Friday night during happy hour. It was very loud (my only complaint).

45Opj3LPHfkpzmTQXzvkoQ.text: I used to go to FEZ at its old location years ago. Back then it was much better. I thought they went out of business and then I happened to be driving on Central and saw the new location. So happy to see it, I decided to grab some lunch to go.  My favorite has always been the FEZ burger. I placed my order and waited, pretty much ignored by the female bartender. I got my food and left.   Very disappointed in the quality. One of the things that makes this burger so good is the pears they put on it, plus the feta and sauce and onion strings. Well.....one side of the two pieces had no pears and the other side had a small piece. On top of that, the burger was super dry and just overall not very tasty.    What makes this all the more maddening is the extreme prices at FEZ. That dry burger was $15 with tax!  Way more in cost then it used to be.  Oh yes and it comes with a side salad?!  Hello, how about some normal fries with my burger. Oh yeah, you can get that for another $2.50!!  I'm sorry but I'm not paying $17 or $18 dollars for a so so, not that huge portion burger. Hello FEZ owners - I'm not rich by any means.  I'm there to support your business and hopefully get a good quality meal like I used to get.  On the positive side - the new location seems nice but I liked the old one too. The bar is probably the best part. This cool sort of octagon shape with a thick granite top (at least I think it was granite).  Considering the difficulty of getting to this location, parking, expensive pricing and sub par quality - I won't be going back.  I'm tempted to call and ask for my hard earned money back for the disappointing meal.  Eat at your own risk

SWlqqe809UryAep0hTku8w.text: A friend recommended Fez for our group of four. Thank you, Randy, excellent choice. Two of us enjoyed the drink special, Orange press. We started with half spicy, half rosemary Parmesan fries. Very tasty! We ordered the beef bererra, calamari, chicken tacos, and a hamburger. Everyone agreed that the meals were very tasty, good quality, and quantity. Candace was our server. She gave us excellent recommendations, and service. We will be back

_bTzRIC9Ed1Qwp9nrav6yQ.text: I live right by FEZ but hadn't been till this weekend. First Friday was wrapping up and FEZ was the only place open and selling food - they can have my business solely because of that.   The patio was very nice: great energy, seating/tables are nice, great location. Our waiter was attentive, friendly, and memorable.   The group got the tacos, gyro bowl, and lettuce wraps. The food was pretty good. Smaller serving sizes than many restaurants but not the end of the world. All of our meals were $2 off because it was after 11pm. The meal was very reasonably priced and good.   Definitely try FEZ if you're in the area.

_CX2fsI2c1tJK1olVvSu1g.text: Luke was my bartender.   He was amazing .. Love his history about the place .. prefect drinks all night.  love you boo

gwMvJrg3LlUQcAtQiLQLpg.text: The burger that I got was very good. The vibes were not bad either! I just had a problem with the prices because they were a little bit steep for a burger and fries.   The service was meh but, I usually don't hold that against places. I would come back but, it wouldn't be my first choice!  Location is tight though.  BB's Rating: Not Badtastic

O9gyDOQBKGfvxBtzhBBOmQ.text: This place is actually pretty amazing. It reminds me of a place in NYC called Elmo... the decor is pretty chik and modern, the food is pretty great and the drinks are interesting. staff is pretty nice (so is everyone in Phoenix apparently)!  We walked in and even though the place was pretty packed, we were able to be seated in the first 2-3 min. the host was pretty awesome and our waiter was ... hot, professional, and very happy to serve us even though he had been working all day. After sharing the daily specials... I decided to move away from my regular margarita drinks and just have the rose sangria with grapefruit. It was ok... honestly, a bit too sweet for my taste, but as a sangria it was strong and interesting and beautifully presented.  As an entree, we ordered a small spinach and lamb Pizza, beef nachos and a chicken cutlet sandwich. My main entree was the nachos. If it weren't for the chicken sandwich, I'd likely had given Fez a lower review... but let's focus on what I had first... the nachos.... too many nachos and not enough cheese or toppings. The guacamole was ok, but should have had a bit more acidity, the sour cream was heavy and thick... I did not touch the red sauce as I am never a bit fan, but it seemed chunky and decent.... my biggest problem is that I ended up with so many nachos with no cheese or any topping on top... there was also a bath of greasy red liquid at the bottom from the beef which made the bottom nachos soggy. Now, the really good part of the meal was the one bite I got from my friends chicken sandwich... I mean seriously  amazing! I think it was called the taz-taz sand which or something... but OMG... the chicken was crispy and moist and double stacked for a high sandwich, the cheese spread added a creamy texture.... the ciabatta bread on additional crunchiness... this sandwich was likely one of my top 10 chicken sandwiches of my life...  Let me say this very honestly... even with the very nice staff and ambiance.... had it not been for this sandwich... I'd likely would say this place is good, but. It enough to bring me back as a regular... that sandwich, well, made me feel like I should come back for it many times more, but also that I should try other options in their menu.  All in all, this is likely a third date type restaurant... it is not noisy, but packed and while nice, it just feels like not the impress me type place considering the food menu pretty much reflects a high end glorified diner.

EY4W8HsF1Sgr9MtF-h3E9Q.text: The food is pretty good, the portions are always a good size. I've been to this location twice. The staff is always super friendly and attentive. The first time I visited I got the breakfast panini. The second time I visited I got the fez fit meal with the salmon.

kq8Rd_2IEuzgSbji4AoPVg.text: BACKGROUND I ate at Fez for the second time last night. Almost everything about both visits were perfect. AMBIANCE The ambience is adorable chic. There is a dramatic central bar, with the iconic Fez chandelier. There is patio and dining room seating, and they even have a little side sofa area to hangout. (see pics) THE DRINKS The drinks were creative and delicious. I tried the watermelon press. (see pics) THE MENU The food was outstanding. The menu includes: Soups: Cumin Cinnamon Carrot Tomato Lentil Appetizers: Fez Fries Chicken Strips a la Fez Fez Baja Tacos Gyro Bowl Fez Nachos Fez Lettuce Wraps Kisra & Hummus (which I had - see pics) Nazari Calamari (which I had - see pics) Lamb Sliders Chicken Phyllo Salerno Bruschetta Plate Salads Burgers Sandwiches Entrees: Turkish Mezze Plate Mediterranean Tilapia Bacon Mushroom Bistro Steak London Bistro Steak Arroz Con Pollo Fez Golden Curry (which I had - see pics) Go Green Pasta Pasta Con Spago Alla Norma Daily Desserts Creative Signature Martinis & Cocktails Wine List: Modest But Original (glass/bottle) Unfortunately, the coffee was served with spoiled creamer, but it was quickly fixed, so no big deal. CONCLUSION 5/5 RECOMMEND OF NOTE *My only complaint is that the parking is confusing and limited. *Hours: Mon - Thur 11am - 12am Fri/Sat 11am - 1am *For more information: FezOnCentral.com

JJwKo-L_lZugvnY_-T6mqg.text: Fez is in a great neighborhood on Central Ave. the atmosphere is cool chic. The day I went there were a couple of drag queens at the bar, so cute. Fez's Happy Hour is one of the best values. Get any kind of signature margarita for $4. I ordered the apricot margarita and it was really good. Also on the happy hour menu was a gyro bowl, which is basically a salad with gyro meat in it. It was tasty. I also ordered the Spiced Peach Manhattan and let me tell you, that drink will knock your socks off. It was very strong. No wonder it cost $12.95, the ingredients are red stag spiced cinnamon whiskey, peach liqueur, lemon & orange juices, lemon bitters. Very much worth the price. All in all this is one of my favorite places to go for Happy Hour after work.

6ev9ixJOtoICSgfcnQ6Qjg.text: Based on FEZ's customer service/management, they are truly a disaster. Earlier this week, FEZ mocked another Yelp reviewer by posting their profile (not their review), and encouraging their Facebook fans to join in on the joke. (The customer simply mentioned that she wished they used natural juices in their cocktails, but had commented on the former FEZ profile that it was "a nice place".) Unfortunately for them, many customers did not support this post, and responded accordingly. The manager, who identified himself on Facebook as Tom, proceeded to publicly attack those who disagreed with the post. About one customer, he posted that they were rude during their visit. He told others that they didn't know what they were talking about, and eventually deleted comments/blocked users if they didn't agree with him. After attacking many of their loyal customers online, someone at FEZ finally deleted the entire post. Perhaps someone had one-too-many of those cocktails without natural juices?  If I'm being honest, the food at FEZ isn't terrible (brunch is okay) and many of the servers are friendly enough. The food and service isn't better than anywhere else, so I'd recommend supporting a business that respects their guests more.

eOTHUa8wU02Mcoc0OKk9Eg.text: Let me start by saying that I am a Fez fan from the old location. I was excited to try the new location last Saturday night after walking around downtown with all of the Super Bowl festivities, dance parties and general fun going on. We were hungry and it was about 9:30pm. We entered Fez's new location, and it was gorgeous! The decor is very cool and modern. We were seated on their beautiful patio, which has individual heaters over many of the tables.... nice touch. This is where things went south. We sat and waited....and waited.... and waited. A table next to us literally got drinks, ordered a dessert, ate a dessert, and paid and we STILL hadn't gotten any attention.... no one came by to give us even water. It was like we were invisible. And don't be fooled, they were not slammed.... the patio was maybe half full and had two servers working it. After waiting and trying to get the attention of one of the waiters, we decided to leave... obviously they didn't want our business. We walked out with one of the waiters from the patio who had no idea that we hadn't had any service at all and still didn't acknowledge us. This was too bad because I really like the food at Fez (at least at the old location, didn't taste anything here). This makes me think twice about coming back here.

cE3tVeEoqoTLaEFo1FrhwQ.text: They need to change up the food menu and need to make cocktails with fresh fruit juices!

MK-Nuv6MjtkyrIqd27TQbw.text: What a joke the service is so incredibly slow and when they finally brought out our order it was wrong! I would not recommend this place at all!

I could have ordered the $1.99 tacos and saved $15.  Don't go with a large group; venue not set to handle multiple orders.

Even though the portions were large we all ended up licking our plates clean it was so good.

V93IGO7Q56HOSppGxBkgOQ.text: When I thought Fez couldn't get any better it did. I was thrilled when Fez was moving closer to downtown because it was closer to my home. I highly recommend the egg white omelette for brunch. It is filled with spinach and was absolutely divine. I also tried the new yellow curry dish for dinner and that too was also amazing. Personally I think service is even better in this new space. Right on the light rail with a huge patio. I brought a colleague there for lunch yesterday and had one of their signature salads as well. The butter leaf salad is awesome.

hFJb8D2sWjOH8LljAxR7mw.text: I went to FEZ on Valentine's Day not necessarily expecting stellar service ... but I got it anyway! They were GREAT! I don't know how anyone could give them a negative review.  I ordered the special that night, and it was absolutely amazing. I will certainly be back for more (imagining what the service and food might be like on a night when the place isn't bonkers on a 45 minute wait!) I used to go to brunch all the time at the other location; this location is way more urban and hip - fitting for the typical FEZ customer IMHO.

Qfp_lRZjJBmQYRzpcr6PBg.text: Love the new location! Don't go for happy hour, though. Not so happy. Very limited selection.

Vz8-HAwxh-3meqCoj9F8-Q.text: I love the FEZ Burger!! Can't wait to try more of their great food!!

uY5saxXh9aYUMohlkJC8ZQ.text: Very comfortable environment and a friendly staff. The food is delicious & lots of variety.

XKLU2Mt9EN24DKgLCX5_jw.text: Okay, so it sounds like everyone loves fez, it's a nice neighborhood / hip city restaurant that many go to especially on the weekend. Have been to the old fez but never to the new one. So was excited to try it out. Location was amazing, decor, set up and cleanliness was beautiful. Staff was very nice, however I felt that they either were over worked or understaffed the day we got there. Good people, great attitude, just not as attentive as I'd thought they'd be. May be because it's such a laid back / popular place, they kind of let loose. We were a group of 5 and we went for brunch, 2 out of the group shared a burger. I got the Baja breakfast (added chicken to it), my other friend got the golden curry egg scramble, and I can't recall what  my fifth friend had. We also ordered feta fries and regular salt and pepper fries and a bottle of champagne and OJ.   I'm only critiquing my good but along the way I'll explain some miss-haps that could have easily been prevented.   Server was polite and nice, we get our food. Mine looked great (Baja breakfast) and my friend who ordered the golden curry scramble got her plate and had a look of confusion on her face. Once the food was all on the table, she asked me "didn't it say "Scramble" on the menu?" The dish she got had 2 fried eggs. No problem, as the gentleman who brought the food was still there we told him and he said "they're supposed to ask how you'd like the eggs" my friend said that no one asked us. Since the new is listed  "scrambled" on the menu, it is expected to come out that way j less customer asks to have it differently. Just sayin!!!  Then I noticed my dish didn't have chicken with it and as I was about to say something the gentleman bringing the food set a plate of chicken next to my plate saying that he'd just saw it and apologized.   All was good, food tasted amazing (we were super hungry after a charity walk downtown Phoenix). The fries were very well made and my meal (Baja breakfast) was delicious. Now we're done, and been seated for a while, no one has approached. Our server has. It been seen for a while. We get the attention of another server, ask for our bill and a few minutes our server shows up, with the bill.   So in conclusion, I'll definitely go back, and try other dishes. I love the city vibe there, and the people working there, they just gotta pick it up a little and be more attentive to customers.

NT6X1_yUHGMUF_sMaQrT1A.text: So disappointing!  I told my friends how great Fez was and service was soooo slow, we had a concert to get to, we allowed an hour and a half to eat--plenty of time.  Drinks took 20 min, dinner took another 35 minutes. Food was just ok.   I may never go again.

fOD8l2rCr0ikrpA_D6Uyuw.text: I have been to FEZ many times before and the food is delicious, but this time I discovered my new favorite sandwich in the whole wide world. But first I'll start with the appetizer.  Homemade chips and guacamole for $2 off which was awesome.  Happy hour drinks were good...and strong.  But the Casablanca chicken sandwich...oh, Casablanca.  In the spirit of full disclosure, I would run across a mine field for goat cheese.  But this sandwich took it to a whole new level.  And my wife had the gyro pita and said it was the best she's ever had.  I don't know what else to say other than YUM!

photos.caption: Photo of FEZ - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Casablanca Chicken Sandwich
Photo of FEZ - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Gyro pita and salt and pepper fries

pNZ0Xioxs8PLR34MFVd-mQ.text: Cute place to eat! Ordered the nachos with the cheese on the side because i don't like soggy nachos. Really good. My friend ordered the tacos and loved them as well. We will definitely be back to check out the brunch. I saw a lot of things on the menu that I would like to try like the lamb sliders and hummus. Last but not least, our waiter Devin, was amazing. He knew the menu and knew exactly what to recommend. Thanks Devin!

photos.caption: Photo of FEZ - Phoenix, AZ, United States

R32OR94gdhg6QJsNmHJF1g.text: This place is awesome!! It is such a welcoming restaurant with friendly staff. My boyfriend has talked highly of the food here for quite some time now so we finally came here for brunch on Sunday. He had never been to the new location so it has been a long time. Let me tell you, the menu is super eclectic, overly creative and wants you to come back to try more of their awesome put together dishes.  The staff, first of all was super friendly and welcoming. We sat at the bar (as we always do wherever we go) and the bartenders and manager were all very nice.  My boyfriend has boasted of this "FEZ burger" for quite time so he obviously ordered it, and subbed salt and pepper fries as the side. So dang good! The pears, the molasses sauce, the bun...heaven on a piece of colorful ceramic that matched the eclectic atmosphere.  I got the chicken pita, sub lettuce for pita, lol. It was excellent! I loved the pomegranate sauce and the dried fruits! Chicken was cooked perfectly and the grill/char flavor was present which I love. The side salad in the lemon herb dressing was great too! I loved the rainbow carrot diced in thin shreds on top.  We also got the drinks...I ordered the jalapeno Bloody Mary, so good, I also had the G-Spot drink, at only five bucks each, not only a great deal but great drinks!  We will be back, it was an excellent dining experience and the parking is actually really easy :)

ekGP5Ei6ymBb-l8k03LRtA.text: Amazing!  Hummus is top 3 ever. Chicken sandwich with a lettuce wrap had incredible flavor. Can't wait to go back. One of my favorites in Phoenix.

Xf1B_X4ybH7zKbLRFdFDvw.text: Fez Burger is the best burger I've ever had. Period.  The sweet potato fries sprinkled with cinnamon is also a great twist on fries.

n3mW2mUPzrAoiva7d0kLVw.text: Wow. The food was a flavor explosion. Had the black bean burger and it had a chipotle sauce on it that was the perfect compliment. No ketchup!,!  The little salad with it that was so good.  It was mixed with a cabbage/slaw that was a perfect match!

tkAF6Xu7cwd2UVoaN3B7nA.text: New location, still 5 stars. Food is still as great as before, the drinks are still pretty solid and staff is still pretty darn awesome. Been here multiple times now and every single time the place just crushes it. The outdoor patio is dog friendly - bring them puppies ! There is ample parking in the parking structure adjacent to the building, its name escapes me and so that is always a plus. Best part, happy hour at a reasonable time. From 3:30-6:30 pm & 11:00pm-close ! Yaas ! And not to forget the best darn veggie burger in town with a delicious goat cheese spread. Pure heaven !   Here is the best part about fez for which I will willingly overlook most things - they are very involved in the community and they are very socially forward thinking which means I will gladly wait for that nth martini on tini tuesdays !

WIpmAkAguiuysRci8f2Y9Q.text: I visited Fez with a few girlfriends during my time in Phoenix this past March, and I was actually pleasantly surprised by both the food and the service.  First of all, the bar itself is beautiful. One thing I really appreciated about the design is that the bar is actually a circle rather than just a long straight counter like most bars. This set-up was perfect for chatting with friends; we were still able to chat even if we weren't sitting right next to each other! The menu itself is pretty unique - this isn't just basic bar food. We shared a couple of different appetizers. Notable options are the Fez lettuce wraps and the Fez fries. The lettuce wraps were probably my favorite: the dried pears were a nice touch, and overall I felt they were both healthy and delicious! For the Fez fries, we got a combination basket of the cinnamon dusted sweet potato fries and the salt and pepper fries. Both were extremely tasty and addictive. I'm a fan!  In addition, the bartenders were absolutely wonderful and they even gave me a complimentary chocolate brownie with ice cream for my birthday. It was probably one of the best brownies I've had in a long time. If I ever get a chance to venture back to Phoenix, you can bet I'll definitely be back to Fez!

np38Z3wEDslhtv6aG72GGw.text: Great place for food and drinks. It can be meaty, light or just darn good. Some of the salads are interesting. The fresh ingredients are the reason why we come back for more. Service at the bar is good.

photos.caption: Photo of FEZ - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Protein Punch Plate
Photo of FEZ - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Side salad

69PiGCDFvnofxEtHEieCtQ.text: I have not been to FEZ since it moved to this location.  Nice new digs, modern decor, and fancy lights.  The service was OK and the food was OK too.  I remember everything I had before was SO good.  From burger, mac and cheese, pizza, and brunch.  We were sat in the patio at the smallest table they can find (fits 2 people), then other parties of two came later got to sit at a table for 4.  I ordered the romana pasta with chicken:  classic creamy parmesan & garlic sauce with penne pasta served w/garlic bread adding grilled chicken.  It was just OK.  The garlic and rosemary fries were the best thing out of the whole meal.  Just was not how it was at the old location and with Thomas still there.

photos.caption: Photo of FEZ - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pasta with chicken
Photo of FEZ - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Garlic and rosemary fries

ewjIKVOOq79Ui4fZ5P6c9Q.text: The food's ok.  Maybe I'm not a huge fan of the selection.  The happy hour deals aren't worth the trip and I didn't see anything on the menu that was enticing enough to try.  Hummus was fine, cheesy cauliflower was fine.  Chicken tenders were fine, although I wasn't a fan of the taste or feel of the crusting.  The sauce that came with it was good.

U9es2WQbVRxEm1warypJhw.text: $2 off apps 3-6:30! Lettuce wraps were amazing! Also got 1/2 cinnamon dusted sweet potato fries and rosemary garlic fries for less than $5!

photos.caption: Photo of FEZ - Phoenix, AZ, United States

qYGRZLagxxA2hhvXTF6B8A.text: I enjoy meeting friends at Fez.  Always good food, casual dining, cute waiters (can we still say waiters?)!!

LFoAg1aCOaPwvEPZMcZZIQ.text: Came to Phoenix on vacation. FEZ was our first stop. This place is a must try!! Our bartender (Chris) was VERY attentive and super friendly, as well as all of the staff here. Me and my boyfriend got a few items to share. Hands down the best food we had the entire trip! There is so much flavor to everything. Mimosas and bloody Mary's were right on point. If we ever come back to Phoenix we will come back to FEZ no doubt! Very artsy and fun place!  Came here 3 days in a row, it's that good!!

YLwHC7CTtl9-E6OXMMer7g.text: The perfect spot for us after being at an event at the Phoenix convention center we had a booth all day dealing with the public  And said we need a good good meal to give us back our energy I had the salmon with the golden rice and vegetables and my husband had the curry vegetable dish we were both very satisfied with our meals and the service was wonderful we had a new waiter in town about six months he was just delightful the atmosphere is always good not too noisy and of course we try to get there mid to late afternoon so we can just relax it is always our first choice when we are in downtown Phoenix and we know restaurants we live in old town Scottsdale

photos.caption: Photo of FEZ - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Phoenix convention center where we signed books on Saturday before heading to the Fez for a wonderful dinner

riG0eIyyBu42VkgCbDjHFQ.text: No longer what it used to be. I'd write more but why bother. Save your time and venture elsewhere, the Phoenix metropolis has more to offer. Not bad here but used to be better. Staff still ultra friendly.   No ambience. Who wants to sip on a martini after hours with bright lights. PASS!   Failure.

4JU3cflfANu2Nthheokadg.text: We stopped here for dinner after visiting the Art Museum because it was highly recommend by hotel staff. It's open late which is nice because we were struggling to find places that would be open past 9pm. We loved it! Parking was easy as there is free 2 hour parking in the ramp right next to us. We ordered the Fez Curry, Strawberry Blueberry Salad, and an order of cinnamon sugar sweet potato fries. Everything was delicious and I would visit again next time I'm back in Phoenix!

_Hm28S0QGabVjjVXFtAq6A.text: Love this place! Nicholas is such an amazing server and bartender. He is awesome and had the best recommendations. Tuesday's are a great day to come in for their $5 martinis! Just shared some apps with friends tonight. Didn't get to try the entrees but will next time!

QueRcJUjA9SDTYpr9Mh9zg.text: Nice place a little expensive for the amount of food, the servers were efficient but the kitchen was slow getting out food. I love supporting the #LGBT community. The adult beverages looked amazing but we didn't participate in day drinking

AZ1kUCKtLL901a0dMcUKiQ.text: Over priced !!!! My burger was dry , the fries were soaked in grease . N the service was ok . The only thing good was my drink from the bar . The parking is a little inconvenient.

sVRg8Eofn0eEXj_p4S7wTg.text: We enjoyed eating at this restaurant. The chicken Phillo dough was very tasty and flavors meshed well together. Service was attentive and they refilled our waters. My husband enjoyed his veggie burger - black bean burger was nice.

-vDKED6OeWEwo5TMwtBySA.text: I ask for a table and there are 8 of us. The hostess informs me that we cannot be seated. They cannot accommodate large groups.   I've never had a restaurant tell me that before. I expected to have to wait, but not to be told I couldn't be seated.  I'd give zero stars if I could.

Z0acVTLVHjBRh2eim7zhrQ.text: I kept wondering why the new FEZ was getting lower reviews than the older one, I finally understood why this past weekend.   I used to think the FEZ burger was the best burger, ever. Maybe it was an off night? I want to find a reason to love this new location like the other one. One of my worst nightmares is getting my burger well done when I ordered it medium. *sad face* Unfortunately, I ordered it as take out, so by the time I got home, I was too hungry to even complain.   When I have gone to the new location, the food just doesn't taste the same. The cumin cinnamon soup was watered down, they sat us next to the door that kept opening (during December), and the food was less tasty.

pF5O8AV2s291j9j1L7ejgQ.text: This friendly and very gay restaurant tries hard, but the quality of their food doesn't match the niceness of the staff. I never felt uncomfortable, unwelcome, or idiotic at the restaurant until the food arrived ... then I thought, "Why the hell did I order this?"  A "Grill Platter" was edible -- but only the protein portion. The vegetables were soggy, disgusting, and forgotten extras of a play. The main star, the salmon, was tender, but a little small.  A salad of Strawberries, Blueberry, and Cashews was not mind-blowing, but a salad is a salad.

xs_F8J1deRfvbVjnyJU7FA.text: Update:1/15/2015: This sounds so primitive and disappointing.... but the owner blocked anyone who has commented on the facebook Fez page and deleted the comments selectively. I always liked that place at the previous location but obviously after interacting with the owner and witnessing his immature behavior ... I'll definitely refrain from spending my money on anything that has his name on it.   1/14/2015: The owner has been fighting with everyone on their facebook page, claiming that we were rude to them on opening night when they pushed us to the patio ~it was freezing cold and already had made the reservation! Let me put here what I wrote earlier back to him:  Rude treatment"? Really? I was there that night. I've pictures to prove. Will be posting shortly. When we were froze to death! Ask server to move people who were standing on top of our heads and smoking in a "non-smoking" area and she said they would still smoke!!! Ordered food that supposed to have chicken and order got messed up. No apology and RUDELY he brought some grilled chicken in a separate plate after 15 minutes and told me here's your chicken. Allowing people to smoke in a non smoking section is definitely something you should train your staff to STOP not to encourage!!! Pictures worth 1000 words~ here Ya go!!!

photos.caption: Photo of FEZ - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Enjoy salmon w second hand smoking in the Wild Wild West in a non smoking zone. Who should I report this to?
Photo of FEZ - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Messed up order-no apologies, rolled eyes-15 min later brought grilled chicken. I kept my sanity, paid quietly  and walked away
Photo of FEZ - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Really? Smoking in a non smoking section next to our table .. Reported/ ignored/ walked away

bmszloEg3PLyCvpcR-6fnA.text: I was apprehensive after reviews and photos here, but the eggs Benedict was amazing! Great taste and sauce...I would go back again just for it! I'm not usually a breakfast/brunch person, but this Sunday am I gobbled it down! (Forgot to take a photo!) Our server was nice but a bit busy, and other servers were not too friendly when we asked for help.  Otherwise, great setting and location along with yummy food!

8mz8MnHfVYcEeFKq54veXA.text: My boyfriend and I attended lunch at FEZ on a Saturday afternoon. We both heard the food was great and were eager to try a spot just walking distance from my house.   The staff was friendly and our waiter was nice, but we can't get over the outrageous pricing for two HALF sized salads. We both ordered the FEZ 1/2 salad. I ordered mine with grilled chicken and he ordered his with salmon and avocado. On the menu it DOES list that avocado is a $2.25 up-charge which we were ok with. The meats were all listed to be "market prices."  We received our salads and were quite disappointed. The food itself did taste great. But definitely not worth the money. For $2.25 you get 5-6 slices of avocado, you can buy a whole one at Safeway for $1. But the worst part was out total bill for two 1/2 salads and only water to drink was $39 with tip! Outrageous!!

4FNwmHLV6y1mxvC88bNzIQ.text: At lunch today: Kids both order chicken strips. Server offers fries or fruit instead of veggies. Kids of course say yes. $2.95 upcharge per kids meal...never disclosed by the server and not printed on the menu (kids burger comes with fries after all). Server got our fries order wrong...told us that when we asked for "S&P" (as it is described ON THE MENU) she thought we meant sweet potato. Huh? Both adult salads were filled with limp, wilted, brown lettuce. At the end of the meal the server offered to get the manager, then came back with no manager and a list of excuses. Never coming here again.

fRUaieCMTi0WZAphe3BoZw.text: Not a big fan of the new location. I lived walking distance from the old location so I guess I'm a bit biased, but driving down seems like such a chore after being spoiled with a quick walk.  There parking garage is easy to access and it's a quick 2 minute walk to Fez. That being said, I think the new seating is uncomfortable. Any empty table had a reserved sign, so we sat at the bar. The stools are modern and look very cool, but there's no back support and it just felt a little weird.  Food was still good. If you're new to Fez, try the Fez burger with sweet potato fries, the Fez fit plate, or the arroz con pollo. Service wasn't as good, though. My water was never refilled and it took a long time to get to go boxes and our check.  I'll be back because i like the food and it's still pretty close to me, but probably not as frequently.

bYd8KvCQo5Ax0cOlV2vBoQ.text: Great place with great vibes! Not from the area and just stopped in! Had a Mule with pear vodka that was Delish! And the spice road chicken sandwich which was sooooo good! Seriously nothing bad to say!

MkF-NqAZDd1vdVJRJRQOSg.text: Awww so disappointed.... We came for brunch on a Sunday, and were surprised at how mediocre the food was. And we're talking about mediocre meaning it ACTUALLY tasted like defrosted frozen meals. Edible, you'll finish it because you paid for it, but you leave slightly ticked off because you had such high expectations that were not fulfilled.   The atmosphere was very Scottsdale. Personally, not a fan (which is why I live downtown Phoenix), but I guess it's good that there's an establishment that caters to all types of people. Think loud club-type music on a Sunday morning and a modern-retro vibe that comes off almost kitschy.   Probably won't be coming back to this place since there are other amazing dining options within walking distance.....

j88vlkc-rXPHEJx9GeBqgA.text: Something about the new place reminds me of the Ikea dining area. Fez is open, clean, efficient... but lacks warmth. I feel rushed here, like I'm in the way. The bar area is large and looks great, but tends to get incredibly loud no matter what time of day. 3pm on a Thursday and it was impossible not to yell in order to hold a conversation, no matter where you're seated inside.  I've noticed some of the other reviews knocking Fez for moving farther away from them. This is absurd, guys. It's 2 miles south on the exact same road, and it's still off the lightrail. A restaurant doesn't need to consider every patron's home address before relocating and it's unfair to dock review points based on this.   That said... it's now incredibly close and convenient for me so I will definitely be back.  Last night (1/14/15) the Fez Facebook page posted a link to a 1 star Yelp review pointing out that, contradictory to the reviewer's belief, they DO use fresh ingredients in their cocktails. The initial post didn't mock her or seem to have any outright ill intent, but the comments quickly became catty and immature and the post was removed. Whether this was meant to make fun of the reviewer or not, posting it on Facebook was seriously in poor taste when the option to reply directly exists right here on Yelp.

GDuwaQvDWt2559_udFyeRw.text: "So......Fex moved." I had to be unfortunate bearer of bad news. Jenny was a Fez fan and, in her defense, the new location is a bit less convenient for us. While my biggest question mark was how they planned to address parking, I have no problem with the couple extra miles biking down Central we'd have to put in to get there.  To second the other reviews, Fez does seem more 'bar-ish' this time around and I'm not sure if it is intentional. The bar is larger and isn't partitioned off as it had been before. I also visited on the evening when many of the tables were marked reserved but not occupied during the entirety of my visit. Still, the food and drinks were as good as expected and the service was good.   I'll hold out an incomplete for the time being. It was their first week at the new location so I'm not ready to write it off just yet. But, rest assured, this isn't going to be your father's Fez.

vrARiVXt4FQq-r4tp9J5sA.text: Service was good, food and drinks were not. Had the lamb sliders. 3 were well done and the fourth was under cooked, i asked for medium rare. I ended up getting super sick about 15 mins later. #bubbleguts

eWn4P3GBYDUqNm7r3f4YHA.text: Dog friendly patio, crisp good salads:  I had the apple balsamic red onion feta salad with salmon.  Delish!  My friends had the Blue Cobb to rave reviews.

6oEmq7Ywt_CaO6SWwRHZGQ.text: Absolutely wonderful lunch with friends and our dogs on the patio. Their food is fantastic, the salads were great. They do charge a split fee if you split a salad though FYI. But who cares this salad was wonderful. And they love the dogs too. Highly recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of FEZ - Phoenix, AZ, United States

POLNCIk6BE8Vg5nHjNQVfg.text: Agree with past reviews on service; horrible experience there recently and the bartender is rude/condescending to patrons.  The service was poor at the bar area and continued to decline in the dining room for the remainder of our dinner. We always love supporting local restaurants and do so frequently however we will never eat at this establishment again.

Jc3iOhAIe9qtKw-RUfvizw.text: Try the Harissa fries. They are life-changing.  The new location is great, though if you are trying to have a conversation on the patio, the light rail gets mighty loud.

ZrEDe7Y4j5S6V3s2LXwwGA.text: Blueberry margs...$5!  What a way to start!  Being of Middle Eastern decent, we loved the food from start to finish.  We started with a plate of fries that were doused with tsastiki sauce, feta, and chopped onions and tomatoes.  We almost licked the plate.  I had the lamb sliders that were perfectly cooked.  And another blueberry marg (Monday is $5 BIG margarita night).    We adored our waiter, it was either Nicholas or Nathan, something with an N, who had just relocated from Canton, Ohio, who misses him mom, but is helpful, sweet and I would adopt him if I could.  We can't wait to come back to try more.

Ok3j5aIbOfsifF8JSq5Tzg.text: We arrive at 11am with a reservation.  I asked upon check in if we could add a person.  I had requested patio seating.  The "host" wanted to argue about my patio request, really?  I know it is not guaranteed, but I did request and had the email to prove it.  Our complete party was not there so we didn't mind waiting.  15 mins later he seats us a four top? I said there is a fifth person coming.  No problem I will get you another menu and another chair.  The rest of my party arrives, no chair!  Had to get his own!  It's now 1130 and no server has greeted us and no water.  In the mean time other new tables are coming in and getting served!  The "host" needs help.  Once our server finally arrived the service was OK.  Don't trust their online reservation system!  I must say their food is above average, however the price is reflective of such.

0_MLiy_NJDE2YiU_Dn9ftw.text: Let me start by saying we loved this local establishment an were customers a minimum of once a week and as far back as their location at Central and Indian School. However our experience when we stopped in for dinner and cocktails on 07/10  @ 8:00 was shocking.  Restaurant  was full so we said we'd sit at the bar instead of waiting for a table. Asked the hostess if she could ask a patron to scoot over who was sitting in the middle of two empty seats (3seats total) She said "No, that's not my job" my reply "but your a hostess" she said " No, I am a waitress".  So Instead I gave her my name for a table, and as she walked away she said "your such an asshole" I said excuse me, she said "your an asshole" and she went off.. I asked for the manager, she refused to get him, asked for her name she refused to provide it.  (black lipstick makes her easy to identify) Asked another employee for the manger and finally made contact. He was apologetic and genuine, offered to comp a meal but we left and went to Match across the street which was delightful. Never have I been called an "asshole" for simply requesting a seat so I can give a business my money.

aJTCxAj-bMcctrbi_zMdRg.text: Worst.service.experience.ever. We were absolutely astonished by the abrasive, terrible experience that we have EVER had. We tried to order take out by phone but was hung up on when the staff couldn't figure out how to turn off the fax machine & an obscenity was shouted, then hung up on. We then went to the restaurant to order. The guy that obviously tried to answer the phone before then used obscenities toward us and was completely rude, AGAIN. How can this person work in the service industry? We were looking forward to dining there but will never go back, so disappointed & outraged. This guy needs to fired!

yiL_wUzaQrlpy-PIPeQl2Q.text: Good selection of beers and drinks.  I think if you have a drink called Manhattan, it should be close to the classic but made with unique classic ingredients....not egg whites.  I tried it anyway. The gyro salad was tasty.  The fries tasted from frozen, not fresh cut.  Bar service was friendly and informed.

B1PQe8yIh6Pc8_fs3U1q5g.text: There service alone was 5 ! On very short notice, they were able to take a reservation for 17 people when another restaurant ended up being closed on my birthday. The staff was super welcoming and accomodating and our server, Marissa was incredible! She was cheerful and calm around our rowdy bunch and she kept dinner running smoothly all the way to the very end with multiple split checks. I know that can not be easy but she rocked it! Everyone was really pleased with their meals. the food was delicious. Thank you FEZ!

vSxbJnApGxtc1KIUzpEgxA.text: Bad service with rude waitress and good but not worth the expensive charged food,  a sandwhich with hummus slapped on it and a few sprigs of salad is hardly what i would call Mediterranean.  That waitress though is for sure the reason I'm not coming back.

nn6UIY84nztmwuieCJboxA.text: Food was great all around . My cousins ordered the gyro and fez burger ; meanwhile my girlfriend got their tangier burger.  All the burgers were fantastic including the side salads ! Because they got burgers I chose to order something different,  so I order the Turkish plate. The Israeli couscous,  baba ganoush , and hummus all received an A-, but the chicken breast I ordered with it was SOOOO THIN that it looked like a sheet of paper.

photos.caption: Photo of FEZ - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Turkish meeze plate

FQjtuTqBFH3m3kjL6k8hlw.text: Really thought I'd like this place, heard great things from friends... alas.  Super pretentious L.A. type atmosphere. Loud music, plus the acoustics made all the talking combine into a racket of its own. Our server was... odd. I can't put my finger on it. He seemed pretentious in his own way. He never addressed me, but spoke to my fiance the entire time.   Got the Fez burger and the Tangier burger. Both were cold. There was a long list of delicious sounding things that were supposedly on them, but they all must have either been not there in adequate amounts, or just mixed together, because the Fez just tasted like a cold burger on a ciabatta bun, and the Tangier tasted like a cold burger on a ciabatta bun (with pesto).   You don't get fries; those are an extra $3; you get a 'salad' which is just carrots, lettuce and arugula. The lemon basil dressing was really good, but most of my greens had nasty black spots.. only half was edible.   We didn't send anything back as we were in a hurry and I didn't feel like arguing with managers.  Total for 2 burgers, one with added fries and $3 for added bacon, was $34. That's pretty pricey, especially considering the state of the food.   I think this is one of those places that isn't very good, but it's popular and pricey (so it must be good!), and you want to fit with the hipster crowd, so you pretend to love it and go there all the time.

fcs1JlrJ3IB2u-YUhVHDiw.text: Very good food and drinks. Comfortable seating. I ordered the  rosemary chicken sandwich with fries. One of the best ever sandwich hands down.  The pesto sauce on the sandwich really enhanced it's taste to the next level. Really impressed and will be back. Four stars only because of the slow service. Our waiter didn't even refill the glass of water. I'm hoping next time will be different.

_W9ac9QY8zBDlA-O3hcC3w.text: I am an avid fan of Fez and have been for quite some time. I never post reviews but they are deserving one especially for their new location. Great atmosphere. Roomy and they have added new cocktails and food.  When you frequent a certain place its important to keep it fresh and they have done that.  This was my first brunch experience with them and hands down some of the best eggs Benedict I have had around. Can't neglect to mention the staff.  They always have a smile and aim to please.   My favorite Tini Tuesday!  Hope to see you there

photos.caption: Photo of FEZ - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of FEZ - Phoenix, AZ, United States. One of their friendly bartenders

fZnoR5FW4fU3ch-6kKzWrA.text: We were visiting Phoenix and a friend suggested Fez. So glad that we went. It was really fun, the waiter was great and the food & drinks were delicious! Had a blast! Will return on our next trip to Phoenix.

VgLa5H1qKH0LB4sBJKBpDQ.text: You have to try the cheesy cauliflower dip!!!!  It is so amazing.  I mean everything is good,  but you can't get this anywhere else.   I'll go back just for that!!!

jDeuW85oHVjQD5kwBvsOPw.text: I had the Harissa fries and they were out of this world. the tan-tan chicken sandwich with crispy panko chicken breast with a hummus spread, green olives, oven roasted tomatoes, spinach and bell pepper aioli was fantastic.  The chicken was nice and tender and not dry like a lot of chicken sandwiches can be. Definitely a place to check out.

ukdzwwDcSGjchO_bpAV-xQ.text: FEZ has the perfect balance between creative/modern cuisine and a warm and welcoming atmosphere.  Since moving downtown, this has been our go-to spot for a drink and quick bite. Every single waiter/waitress we've ever had has been not only enthusiastic but genuinely knowledgable about the food and drink menu in detail.   I love restaurants that serve an interesting, progressive meal (start to finish) without feeling too "out there" and unrelatable.   FEZ, don't change a thing!  p.s. They have a thing about sauces. All I can say is, try them all.

tfVwTuEQoh981U9C19bqEg.text: A great place in Phoenix for years now.  Love the drink specials and the staff are amazing.  Some menu updates would be great but plenty of favorite dishes to keep coming back to again and again.  Love the salt and pepper fries and the Fez burger is my all time favorite.

uKXMZPsVoN6pRUfX8QpWIA.text: We came here celebrating a birthday. The new location is a lot bigger and fancier than the last one. Our Server is so attentive. We will be back.

jpCLl3-nQ7Qw0rf9csjVcw.text: Customer service here is superb! Bartender Luke is phenomenal. Food is delicious. Great, fun crowd. A local fav. Highly recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of FEZ - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tangeraine burger and chicken strips
Photo of FEZ - Phoenix, AZ, United States. $7 bruschetta and $4 Martinis for reverse happy hour!

FjJ7PXs8EQ-LYgtHRpt4MA.text: Now, I've been coming to Fez for a few years and have had a wonderful experience each and every time until last night.  A couple of friends and I went out for dinner and drinks, last night, food was great, as always, and we had an amazing waiter, they were very attentive (they filled up my ice water without me noticing and a second time before my glass was empty). Now, my friends and I were so caught up in catching up that one of my friends forgot to leave a tip (which, by the way, is not like them). So, our night came to an end and we left and as we were walking back to our vehicles, our waiter runs to us and I assumed it was because one of us forgot our card, but no, they came up to my friend and gave them their receipt and said "were you not going to leave a tip?" We were all thrown off, and my friend asked if they had a pen and they just said "no" and walked off. Now, at this time, we're startled. Fez is one of my favorite restaurants in town, I had my birthday dinner there and I've never experienced anything so unprofessional before. We understand the value of a tip but for someone to leave their establishment, run after us and rudely question us about a tip is unacceptable and very unprofessional. Because of that, my friend returned the receipt without leaving a tip (mind you, we just had a drink), and we continued on our way and then the waiter runs out after us AGAIN and tells, no, not tells, they yell at my friends and tells them that they're not welcome back to Fez ever again. Some words were exchanged and it all finally came to an end.The waiter didn't have an issue with me because I'm a regular and they said that I was welcomed back but my friends weren't. Again, Fez is one of my favorite places to eat, I've recommended it to friends, even to visitors looking for a fun place to enjoy a drink or food, but after the experience that happen last night, I'm not very eager to go back. Now, I think this whole thing could've been resolved or handled better if the waiter was more polite and professional, as they were when they were serving us.  All in all, I've been to Fez numerous times and this is the only bad experience I have had but it definitely did leave an impression on me.

FP2V7iKnhfJjjZh3yZe_Xg.text: $5 martini classics on Tuesdays! My friend had the cherry bomb, $5 normally $10. Other friend had the donkey punch mule. Both strong. If not clear or don't know, caters to LBGT audience, welcome to everyone of course.  Very friendly staff. Few friends and I just had drinks and a few apps. The lamb sliders were delicious. Interesting great twist on a classic appetizer.   Fries to share come in several choices for seasonings and garnishes, you can even mix two.

qa-n5nufznRHIZ60mWapfA.text: Came here on a recommendation. Judging by all the rave reviews, Phoenix folks might be used to a lower standard of food and drink than other major cities. Decent food and ok drinks, certainly nothing worth 5 stars except their VERY pretty wallpaper.  Strange and unappealing menu. Reading it had the effect of making me Google the nearest In and Out Burger and wish I'd parked closer. I tried the lamb sliders. Tasty meat but way too greasy with little else but some pita scraps on the plate,  I can still taste them in my throat a day later.   Decor was pretty. Staff was quite friendly and very attentive. One woman bartender had the disgusting habit of playing with her hair a lot then coughing into her hand then serving every martini with her dirty fingers resting on the top of the rim of the glass. We watched her do it with literally every martini she made, all night, on $5 martini night. If you go in, make sure to order from the bartender with purple hair who was wonderful and kept her fingers and germs off all the rims.  Located in a vapid master-planned Disney Park version of a hipster-hood, complete with 1 deranged mental patient screaming to himself on the corner for authenticity. Would have given Fez 3 stars for trying (and for their wallpaper) except for the unsanitary mixology habits of bartender #1.

h3LJblDyOgXA61wjVB_Z9w.text: Cool, hipster restaurant/bar with flashy lights and a retro vibe. I really enjoyed the fez burger that I ordered. Drinks were on point and happy hour is until 6:30. I'll definitely be back again!

hyV6sGgnJqHzlM8o3lkeyg.text: Fun Taylor fact: MANY years ago young baby Taylor and her friends were invited here by some guy we all had mutual friends of. He then proceeded to order a bunch of drinks then left us with the check! It is safe to say ten years later I have had much better experiences here lol. I live walking distance away so Fez has become a frequent spot for the bf and I to sit on the patio and have a drink (or four). Service is always friendly and prompt and the people watching is top notch. I've been known to order the Feta Fries a time or two with their lemon vinaigrette instead of ranch for two reasons: 1. I pretend it's healthier 2. It's tangy and delicious! I'm also a huge fan of their Golden Curry {coconut yellow curry | zucchini | carrots | peppers | Basmati rice} and I'll add chicken or shrimp for some extra protein.

photos.caption: Photo of FEZ - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Golden curry with shrimp

aslKIsS56xx4_u4-9ag93A.text: Came to Fez for a late dinner on a Saturday night. We were seated quickly and our waiter was prompt and helpful. We got the fez feta fries, calamari and chicken phyllo packets for the table. They got our order mixed up and accidentally brought us an order of their hummus, when we told them we didn't order it they ended up just giving it to us while our phyllo packets were cooking. The hummus was actually really good! The chicken phyllo packets were delicious with their dipping sauce and the fries are a good guilty pleasure, topped with bacon, ranch, feta and green onion. What's not to love? Calamari was also a solid choice. For my main course I got the caprese kisra, it had good flavor but wasn't anything too special. It reminded me of a pizza I've had at pita jungle. Overall, Fez is a good spot for late night eats. I got a Pomtini (pomegranate vodka with pomegranate infusion), it was pretty strong so you get a punch for your money but I would have preferred a stronger pomegranate flavor.

3ewFipQNiGVCWQOUW2i_jQ.text: Yum!  The calamari,  lamb sliders, and mango margaritas were delicious!!!! Will be going there again, for sure.

PxQIMibWTnhkmpGcn5feZQ.text: Come here every now and then just for the salads. They're amazing  I would recommend the pomegranate vinaigrette. -1 star for the few times the waiters had a little bit of an attitude but food is always amazing.

n5zqfuKHcp029QbC4miLBA.text: Arrived after the lunch rush and was seated immediately. Great menu with choices to fit all palettes. Service was excellent and food was wonderful. It was nice to be able to sit outside.

veYxS32HVtBJYKydk1_qYA.text: Fun trendy restaurant with some cool food choices and interesting cocktails. Seems very popular with the young college crowd. Great decor and have bar service table service too. Indoor or outdoor seating available too. Had the lettuce wraps they where you yummy.

nr77Kmc_SNB4aw3G7MLwNA.text: Mixed feelings on this place. My initial opinion is that it is a fun, trendy place with a cool bar and decor. Interesting menu, too. However, the service has been very slow every time I've been here and it wasn't even busy. It's a good thing I really liked the chicken phyllo, chicken fingers, and rosemary fries because the cauliflower dip made me feel like I needed to eat fire or drink bleach to get the taste out of my mouth.  The description on the menu should be revised to say warm cauliflower hummus that will burn the nose hairs out of your sinuses. Not sure where the spice comes from but DAMN!  I might give this place another chance but the service really needs some work.

e6K00LKuKsPCqBw8GjNneQ.text: First visit, very pleased. The Fez Golden Curry, with added grilled chicken, was excellent as was the tiramisu. Service was friendly and informative. Great cocktail selection. Nice bar and patio. Free parking garage adjacent to restaurant. So many items on the menu sounded yummy; I will definitely be back!

jun7v1Vq_iY1AY_EuBaQqw.text: This place came through for me and my out of town guest yesterday. We were needing a restaurant with patio sitting for dinner and all the others favs of mine: the vig, Ocotillo etc had 1 hour waitlist. We went here and got seated immediately. My guest loved his sandwich and my food was ok. Wine wasn't all that great because the wine glass had a weird smell. Overall a great experience.

nZges6GIXkAwe0r8V_51qQ.text: Ate Sunday brunch at Fez, absolutely amazing!! Didn't love the LOUD ambience but I guess that's what happens when too many fools have had one to many mimosas lol. I could eat there every weekend, love the overall vibe of the place! The food was insanely good!

4knMi_Zvt321pg3vdoL2Aw.text: Omgeeee like I have nothing bad to say about this place! First of all Candice is the best! Came for Sunday brunch and we ate! I hate the green pasta and it was amazing! Like was such a great portion we split it with my sister. The brunch menu is a must try! If you love brunch is amazing! Like I am coming back! Everyone needs to try this place

jU0RD8Z7IW5zXmJdzRbqng.text: Years ago when I lived in Phoenix, this place used to be my favorite restaurant. I popped in today on my way to the airport and was incredibly disappointed with the shell of it's former self I encountered.  What used to be a Moraccan gem was now a basic burger joint with superficial "middle eastern" style. We waited over 30min after ordering to receive hummus so salty is was unpleasant and a honey shrimp dish that was so soaked in an ultra sweet , syrupy sauce that the majority of the rice and some of the vegetables tasted like the bottom of a panda express trough.  I'll be on the lookout for a new place next time!

f0GxPJuTdO_6yLNP4MJa7g.text: We came here for a celebration and the server, I'm sorry I forget your name, was more than accommodating. I know we were "that" table, with our separate checks, not being ready to order, combining tables and bringing our own dessert.  I know, we're sorry.  But the recommendations and drinks you suggested were spot on. My Bleu Cobb was excellent and the rest of the table was very satisfied. Hopefully the cake softened the blow a little.

uRm2nyjXCJgyA8hfj-czXA.text: Fabulous little eatery on central but parking not so easily accessible. Happy hour offers $5 cocktails so we took advantage of two Martinis for 10! This was welcomed after coming back from Hawaii and paying $27 for a beer and a Pina Colada.   Appetizers were on sale too during happy hour and we ordered the Gyro salad and the Phyllo rolls! Please order this you won't be disappointed. Every bite was heavenly. Burgers were on ciabatta bread and they were the perfect plate to share.   Overall a hip place to come in for fabulous food and friendly service. We'll be back!

nzVmcpcHuvDeGcxX-XvQkg.text: Love this place. It's down the street so walking distance the drinks are great, the bartenders and wait staff are fun and efficient. I'm going to keep coming vack

Mik9bRxhBfnh17gmkPB34w.text: We loved the delicious lettuce wraps! We also had the FEZ burger, which was amazing! We will definitely come back and try other dishes.

7P7cTBCtU8HERmu573h8cg.text: By far the best burgers in town!  We searched high and low and this is our top pick!

2yWrkeJoNgRJ-mVDn4TxVg.text: I'm giving this restaurant a 3 because there was poor customer service. My server Samuel was AMAZING!! He made the atmosphere light and fun for me and my group. The hostess was completely rude from the time we walked in the door to the time we left. She rolled her eyes because I had a big group and we wanted to sit outside after she tried to squeeze us at a small table. THEN When Samuel was kindly taking our order the same rude hostess/ waitress rudely interrupted Samuel and complained in front of us (the customers) that there was another table and they had been waiting a long time to be served, which Samuel thought we were his last table. She should have pulled him aside and told him in private, but she decided to embarrass him in front of his customers. Other than that the drinks and food was awesome! Loved the bartender as well! Thank you Samuel for making our experience so much fun!!!!

wOQMR_lXCfi7eZni_5NqAw.text: I'm in love! Great place for lunch or brunch. Really creative yummy drinks and service was amazing! And the food was soooo good! I had the curry with eggs. Gluten free wasn't on the menu but they made it for us anyway. Really good gluten-free French toast! Michelle, our server was very accommodating! Thanks for amazing meal. It was awesome.

Ordered cocktails and took another 10 minutes to arrive. Cocktails were fantastic.food fantastic. Service horrible. Too bad because such a cool place but we will not be back.

uem2-NTnyXjRkLwH07aTFw.text: I am on the fence about this establishment. The food is never consistent, but I must say that I enjoy the pasta dish and drinks. My portion sizes are not consistent. It depends on who prepares your meal and time of day, I assume.

nFTftNL4CuLlieDzQcL5uA.text: Absolutely love the signature FEZ burger! great combination of flavors, everything is so delicious and the staff is very friendly! I try not to go too often because I want to keep the appreciation I have! LOVE IT. You can't go wrong here!

SvXIx-fps_T5xNfYTYMGYA.text: FEZ has hired a 'parking enforcer.' The problem is that the parking garage is shared with my parking garage. He stopped me yesterday and rudely instructed me that I could not park where I had parked. He did not even see where I parked, or else he would have known that I parked on the upper levels, beyond the gate.  Today again, this guy was lurking, and watching me as I walked down the stairs. He make you feel uncomfortable in your own neighborhood. Please stop this.  Please FEZ, stop harassing people. FEZ is not acting like a good neighbor, and they are certainly not projecting themselves as a belonging in the Roosevelt neighborhood. Obnoxious.

0Ny-jUNJ5jztR4Rwq_6wAA.text: Have tried Fez three times previously.  The service has always been terrible.  Today our party of 2 showed up close to noon.  The restaurant was dead and lots of 4 top table available.  The host told us we would have to "sit at the bar".  I pointed out there were lots of tables open.  He said he wouldn't seat us at a 4 top.  Again, the restaurant was dead. We walked down to Pita Jungle.  The restaurant had a wait list.  We were seated within 5 minutes at a FOUR TOP.   Won't ever return to Fez.

zBBH5_bb9_sbef4b7_NAAw.text: Best burgers in town! They used to be down the street from us, but they moved downtown. Still, we try to go as often as we can. They have a great brunch menu, but we almost always get the Fez burger and sweet potato fries.

CLXG6dgOvLcS82fdsnD2TA.text: Walked in to grab a bite by myself and was turned away because "the kitchen had a wait" ...? As I left I watched a party of four seated.   Hard to park here anyway. I won't be back.

4P-C1wBxaU_1QtMpy5YmMA.text: Service was friendly but very slow even though it wasn't busy. It took 15 mins to get our drinks after we ordered them. I had the chicken and fries for $6 and a $4 happy hour Stella. For $10 my lunch was ok. I don't think I'll be back.

T6U8oDAE0uLpvXUZjtOeog.text: We went to the new relocated FEZ last night for the first time. The second you walk in the door, you are hit with loud obnoxious conversation, and it stays that way throughout your whole meal. The food is still good, however the acoustics in this new place are just horrible! I have tinnitus, and this definitely did not help it whatsoever. I don't think we will be returning any time soon. Also, the waitress short-changed me a $1 on my cash back.  Also, I ordered red wine, and she brought me white wine instead.

Xlw6lZfMZnJJbFZjG25XMQ.text: I absolutely love Fez!! The Fez burger is the best thing ever! We get this almost all the time and never get tired of it. Love their Rosemary fries. Nicely seasoned. Also love their sweet potato fries. So delicious and sweet. Second best thing is their Blueberry Strawberry Cashew Salad. The dressing is not heavy. It's perfect. Perfect combination of fruit and cheese. All their appetizers are good. All their margaritas are amazing! The watermelon one is nice and sweet. Comes with gummy worms.  The service is always great. Love the ambience and lighting. Great place for breakfast, lunch and dinner. A must go to when you're in town.

lHsfFnvFuaPioh0Nkr4Iug.text: Several friends and I took a friend to Fez for his birthday. The service was very poor often waiting a half hour for a server to come around to check if we needed anything. When she did come around, she would ask part of our group personally is they needed anything, the rest of us had to call her back so we could order.  When our dinners arrived, 4 out of 5 of our order were incorrect. They took our food back to the kitchen to talk to the chef. They returned with our same plates after several minutes stating that their menu had changed since moving from their old location.  We pointed out that their printed menu didn't match the food that was brought to us. By this time our food was completely cold.   We kept the food, howbeit cold by this time, to avoid further problems. They, then, completely avoided our table until they brought the check before asking if there was anything else that we needed. Poor form in general!  To their credit, however, they did credit 50% of each of our food tickets and, in my case, did credit the glass of wine I had.   It was just an unfortunate experience. If they were a new restaurant, one could forgive such service and chalk it up to learning and growing pains. This is not a new restaurant, however, and the food and service was much better at their former location.  It's unlikely I'll return.

D-J7J43gQnRfHgf-ppaABw.text: The bartenders here are so nice and very attentive. They make great muddled drinks with fresh ingredients. When the weather is nice the patio is a great place to enjoy a meal. The chicken fingers, tacos and lettuce wraps are very good. Mediterranean spin on the menu. I like the pollo arroz extra spicy!

L5-teHA5IajtAMC-Jr0_Hg.text: Was excited to try this place out after reading amazing reviews from fellow helpers but I am disappointed in the fact that I couldn't try their "delicious" drinks and food. The reason behind it is because we waited 15 minutes without anybody acknowledging after seating us at our table.   I take that back, our "server" brought us water and explained the drink special of the night AND that was about all that was said.   He left and never came back. I would see him walking back and forth ... never coming back to ask if we were ready to order ...   After a long day of driving and walking, this girl just wanted to eat! I have never had to wait that long for a server to acknowledge us and with that said ... we got up and left.   The restaurant wasn't even busy and servers kept walking by us.   I wish I could rate them ZERO stars.

N6Yj5IfXX8YGXxTMkKrW9w.text: Met some friends for happy hour. Greeted with a great attitude & smile. Our server was cheerful, knowledgeable & attentive but not overly so. We only had appetizers, nachos & the stuffed Phyllo & they were quite tasty & filling. Not a fan of the downtown parking but nothing is  perfect. Will be back!

tr_0CTl4YPBhKe2sMhAiNw.text: Excellent Sunday brunch- super nice waiter & the bloody Mary's were delicious and only $5. I will definitely return.

0-KDiCmpnV_reC7gHzNk4A.text: My family and I have been working to get together for brunch on Sundays so we can all catch up. This past Sunday we decided to go to FEZ for some yummy food, a brunch cocktail and to check out thier patio.   This location is much larger than the previous FEZ location and was not very crowded at all. We did get there very early, probably 10/ 1030ish on a Sunday. We decided to go sit out on the patio to enjoy the weather. The patio is nice and was clean. The only part that was a little odd were some random people out on the street that wanted to gawk at us while we ate. We ended up moving away from the seating along the edge (not due to the random people outside, but the sun) and that seemed to fix the situation.   The wait staff was GREAT! The offered to move us because they noticed my mom was not comfortabe in the sun. Also, my daughter stained my dress with some fruit and the waiter brought me some club soda so it would not set (and it did not), so I am very grateful of his thoughtfulness.   The food did not disappoint. I had a mimosa an it was delish, cold, not too much OJ and the OJ was slightly pulpy and sweet..PERFECT! I had the small fruit and cheese board that came with a fresh moz, creamy brie and a fantastic savory and sharp goat cheese. There was also toasted herb kisra, however I will likely ask for toasted baguette next time instead, grapes, green apples, strawberries and the most amazing garbazos! The chickpeas tasted like they had been flash fried and then well seasoned with salt, pepper, chili powder and maybe some paprika. They were crunchy on the outside and soft in the middle--very addictive! The rest of the crew enjoyed the coffee very much and had pancakes (looked ok, but not impressive), eggs (which my daughter, shes one and a half and LOVED the eggs, she literally clapped when we gave her a seconf helping) they looked fluffy and were obviously seasoned with salt and pepper, ham, bacon, potatoes and yummy toasted baguette with olive oil.   We were all happy with our food and will be back! Check them out!   Brunch time! Specials $4 mimosas or $15 for a bottle plus OJ. Yum!
