d9XZDtJjmcDa16rNiGDpjg.text: Luke is amazing!  Thanks for the great food recommendations & great drinks! The nachos are amazing, as well as the martinis....

DZ9xZoq676jvvaEVVkrdDg.text: Went for lunch the other day and had the blue Cobb  salad - it was delicious even though I asked to have the blue cheese left out and ordered it with the champagne honey vinaigrette ! The service was amazing and my lunch partner who ordered the same thing but added shrimp to his salad enjoyed every bite! The restaurant was not crowded and yet it had enough people dining to give it a nice atmosphere. As this is very close to my office I will be back in the near future to try other items !!!

TDbTqrlI4wn4XAjmuL8iRg.text: First of all the setting of the facility was great. The server was amazing! There was however a slight issue. There was roaches. There was a roach crawling behind my back and my friend spotted it as the food was coming out I was grossed out. I was surprised they didn't apologize instead, they just killed the roach and asked if we wanted to move seats. I wanted to leave but my friend wanted to give it a try. We stayed and moved to a new seat. The food was decent. Would I eat there again? I am not sure. I am a little leary about it the restaurant has roaches. If it wasn't for the roach I would eat there regularly and refer more people. The roaches made it uneasy for me.

gcpobNasgcdH05xNucLOQQ.text: It was Friday night, about 8pm. We sat on the patio. There was about 4 tables seated and they have quite a large patio so it was mostly empty and it wasn't exactly packed inside either. Our server was a nice guy but he took our order and then didn't check on is till we were done eating. I had their salad w/ feta and apples with honey vinaigrette. It was good but I prefer Oregano's favorite salad by a lot. My sister had a burger and fries and the garlic rosemary fries were too garlicky.

5gpK-H8j9tLqj5tZjqoFRA.text: Yummy drinks & amazing service.  The food was just alright. It was good, just not necessarily the best for their prices as they can be a tad steep for the food they serve. I had a sandwich my last visit and it was just okay. I remember having a burger several months ago and it was delicious, so maybe I'll stick to their burgers when I return.  Mondays are also Margarita Mondays which mean $6 dollar Margaritas. That was the complete highlight of my visit to Fez! The watermelon & mango margaritas are to dieeeeee for!!! This will be the driving factor for my return visits. We'll be back :-)

JV0w2dQ9pg78EIfl9DGplQ.text: Food was impeccable.  Company was great.  But the attitude from staff was kinda pretentious and a little stuck up.  I pay for good food and good waitstaff, not attitude from waiters that think/feel they are above their job.  If you feel that way, then quit.  Everyone's poop stinks, even yours.

JJPFCDI8660mTQpKAWLWxg.text: The best hummus in all of Phoenix!  Everything we have ordered has been good to excellent whether brunch or dinner. Solid drinks as expected

rXMwGUv6vwX-a2YSxuDmMQ.text: I've been here many times in their other location and always enjoyed the food and service. I brought a friend from out of town after bragging about their food. I ordered the balsamic blue cheese burger cooked medium ... My burger was awful. The meat was very red and mushy and the bun was a struggle to even bite into. I was going to send it back but my friend insisted I just try and eat it. So I tried, but it was just too raw. Our server was great and said she would ask them to fix it. Seemed like they just stuck the burger patty in the microwave and put it back on the bun which made it even worse. The fries I used to love so much were not hot and not quite cooked long enough.   My friend got the baja tacos and said everything was ok except the tortillas seemed like they were not warmed up and easily broke apart when picking them up to take a bite, and ended up just eating the filling.   I'm not sure if I'd go back for anything but drinks.

photos.caption: Photo of FEZ - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Baja tacos
Photo of FEZ - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Undercooked fries
Photo of FEZ - Phoenix, AZ, United States. My burger that was supposed to be cooked medium but was more like raw ground beef and tough as hell bun

grIazV8TNpI87XfsYZ6alQ.text: I love Fez!!! I've been frequenting since they were at their original location! My husband and I even opted to have our wedding rehearsal dinner here. We had amazing service and the great food we've come to expect- all at an INCREDIBLY reasonable price for 25 ppl with drinks. Thanks fez, keep doing what you do! Some great staff that I always enjoy include Nicholas, Luke, Kirk, Candy and Joey! Thanks guys!

N6ZiV7JjykHrQhN3ZCPHjA.text: Our waitress was very rude and the assistant manager was worse. The manager was great and the food was quite good.

5U6Re68aiM1kHEW9sCXxKg.text: Came here for Friday night drinks on a first Friday! It was fun. The bar staff was really sweet and attentive.

bYN2O1nydw4DdEboSwcmaQ.text: Bartender was very attentive, knowledgeable on craft beers, and had great recommendations.  FEZ has one of the best Gyros ever TRY IT.!!!

302qd-5sCeBpadGzH62EOw.text: Not sure why the negative reviews... Same restaurant, better location. There's actually more parking now with a free parking garage right around the corner. And there's a lightrail stop right in front of the restaurant.  Bigger outdoor patio? Check. Bigger bar area? Check. The rest of the inside is about the same size. I like the new color scheme. The only thing I miss is the projector / fake fish tank. The $6 jalapeno burger is a good deal, though I really wish they'd bring back that $5 FEZ burger day. That's my favorite, and I'd eat there more than I already do.

photos.caption: Photo of FEZ - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Jalapeño burger is good, but the FEZ burger is better. And that dipling sauce for the sweet potato fries is always phenomenal.

BUXFfEVtggRLGtWZlZiRiQ.text: I'm updating my previous review of Fez.  I had said never again, but my dinner date insisted that Fez had this amazing drink.  I warned him about my past experiences, but figured I would give Fez one last chance.  We both ordered the G-spot drink (which used to be named something else at the old location) and were disappointed.  My dinner date discovered the new Fez is nothing like the old Fez.  My drink was probably the worst I've ever had; it was mostly soda water.

VtaloTmjdwtwaor3EwdVRw.text: Great atmosphere. Wait staff very friendly. Great place to meet friends for a drink. Had the calamari appetizer and was yummy also had the cider special for the evening and it was light and refreshing.

FO5uJXMQSj2a7FIF813EXg.text: Get a table with Candice if you can, she's the best! Thursday spot drinks are $4, great deal (avoid the Bspot if it's a casual night). Feta fries are to die for. I'll come back for those alone.

2bsVBL5rHLUsoxgCSJtckg.text: great service, great food. We dined there for dinner before a concert. They got us in and out quickly without feeling rushed or sacrificing quality. Easy to find, easy to park.

J7BsZTTl7yLhW2fWryIVCw.text: I love this place.  I come in about once a week and get a Fez burger and it's always amazing.  Generally, I sit at the bar and the bartenders are always friendly and attentive.  The new location on Portland is pretty spiffy, the lighting fixture over the bar always makes me think of Tron, take a look and see for yourself.

nPaMWyFt7IEwq4QgK_VRjQ.text: Stopped by the new location for a cocktail and to check out the new place. Love it. Great service at the bar, happening vibe, great decor and the wife's lemon drop martini was first rate an jumbo sized. My Pinot Grigio wine was awesome, and a nice sized pour. We stayed for an hour or more people watching and having a good time. Will be back for sure soon to try out some food. From what we saw at the bar, some great choices to choose from.

hyPzbBzJ3emiA4kEbuZ49A.text: Great atmosphere,  great food, but pretty pricey. $17.95 sandwich comes with salad but if you order a side of fries for $2.95 you don't get the salad.  I was disappointed in the size of the sandwich.  Ordered steak medium but it was almost well done. Generous with the fries though. $4.75 for iced tea. It was fun, food was good, service was great, but probably wouldn't eat here again unless someone else was paying.

TPUuGDPBln7_eLhNp3bzKw.text: Fantastic!  Great food and staff.  Came across this restaurant by accident and pleasantly surprised.  We live in Flagstaff, but will make sure to come back.

6TpSgn2eC_Y4XmL04wjKAQ.text: I don't think they should charge $2 extra to sit on the patio; what is that all about.  I will sit inside next time or until they change this ridiculous charge.....There were only 4 other guests on the patio tonight

1bEWDiAkD7oQR6QrygZIuA.text: The food is good, staff friendly, service good but nothing special.  I only come here if I am down the street.  The first day I came in it took me about an hour to figure out this was a gay/lesbian joint, but it amazes me there are many regulars here that are still clueless about this.  Oh well.

EDaRIhO9K2VXrMDs4PPXrA.text: Rude and arrogant staff.  9 of us got up and left because of it.  Won't be back.  They should really get over themselves.....cause it has ruined their reputation.   Peace

aqOrg8qdNzi7Sk3-ejpoew.text: Honestly, this was a terrible night. A group of my friends and I met at the McDowell Mountain Music Festival tonight and decided to go to FEZ for some food after we left the festival. It took about 10 minutes for the waiter to serve us. When he finally asked for our drink order, 2 out of 6 of us ordered a beer. The waiter left and then five minutes later returned (without our drinks) asking what they were again. After we re- requested our drinks, he proceeded to say that he could tell we had a few drinks, so he was only going to serve us one beer. We were laughing and talking! I had a total of two beers that entire evening! We were all stunned, and frankly completely embarrassed. Never have we been treated in such a way. Let me go on to tell you that we are mid 30's parents having a night out. By no means were we acting out of control. This was a terrible situation and completely ruined our evening to the point that we decided to leave the restaurant and go home for fear that our food would be tampered with since we questioned the waiters decision to cut us off for no reason. Terrible terrible service. I will never be visiting this restaurant again.

YFX4ErR5R3M3c_4UjByfTw.text: They were simply overwhelmed and did not have near the staff to provide even a basic level of service.  Food was OK but there is a lot of great food in town where you don't have to beg for more water or to get your (not cheap) bill.

U1eY9SqxuJSI-pM86Xw0HQ.text: Went to the new FEZ on Sunday.  Very hungry and ready for a good burger.  Sat outside which was nice and had a good server but she was really busy.  Asked for her recommendation and ended up with the Blue Cheese Burger with a fried egg on top.  I ordered it medium rare and it came out well done.  The egg on top literally could not have been more over done.  It was more like a hard boiled egg.  The smug little man that brought it to me acted like I was crazy to have wanted my egg to be runny.  Is it me or isn't the reason you get an egg on a burger to have the yolk run out.....!?!  I don't know, maybe I am crazy.  I asked to have it redone and the egg and the burger both came out raw.  I didn't have the energy to send it back again but I should have.  I was able to get half of it down (starving at that point and everyone else was basically finished eating) and paid the consequences later.  I did think the fries and side salad were good though.  Don't usually post bad reviews but for some reason felt the need on this one.  There are a lot of places for good burgers in town and this was definitely bottom of the barrel.  The thing that made me most angry though was the condescending, sarcastic guy/manager/food runner that acted like I was crazy.

5Z2_KwO985Gl8KuuwW_ncA.text: 100% over rated. Was there last Thursday night at around 11pm. The chips/guac/salsa appetizer- disgusting! Guacamole was literally GREY(shoulda taken a pic to prove it). The cherry limeade cocktail I ordered from our server Randi prob took 15 minutes to get to me. It was tasty tho! Between the app and getting my limeade Randi had taken our dinner order. 20 mins later she returned with, "the computers went down can I get your order again?" Lol. When the burgers came out-overpriced and mediocre-and on some kind of focaccia/ciabatta bread-No Thank You! And no French fries!! They come with a salad!! Yeah when I crave a burger it usually coincides with wanting to eat healthy-Umm NO!!!! My bad though, I shoulda read the menu. So we ordered the sweet potato fries. They were decent but why cover an already sweet-sweet potato frie with Cinnamon and possibly even sugar??????? Stupid. Horrible value, bad quality, and mediocre service. STAY AWAY!!!! I guess most gays don't really know good food.

KPvrUlsbT9mtLFiV5PoO1A.text: I am not going to sugar coat this review, it was an awful experience. I had been going to their former location for many years and loved it, decided to try the new place out on a Sunday afternoon and here is how it went: We were greeted by a young man and told it was a 20 minute wait, although there were many open tables. We took a look around at the new digs, not bad. We sat on a couch and waited about 8 minutes for our table to be ready, when our name was called we were taken to a 2 seat table in the middle of the restaurant by the front door, we asked if we could take a table further back and we were told they were reserved, ok fine, not 5 minutes later a couple and a baby came in and asked to be seated and were seated in the booth we requested with no reservation.  Our server was also not good, not attentive at all, we sat for a long time before he took our order and then again waiting for water and waiting for the check.  The food is ok at best and overpriced, the salad ended up being $17 because we wanted chicken added and it was not worth it at all, just a bowl stuffed with lettuce and not much more.  It is a shame that the service is so poor and the price for salad pretty outrageous, as this is a FORMER favorite and we will not be back.

ZWQLIt8_XFLd-JE95PWtXg.text: Just tried Fez for the first time today. Friendly staff & great food but 2 salads & 2 waters were $34 + tip..crazy. Will not be back.

GL05yz15nwIIvzf-Tuo3cA.text: Food is great BUT they charge a fee for ordering takeout .. Craziness can't say that I would return

jdWD-VLidrA6oBkIrf_3PA.text: Best food, I have eaten over half the menu items, many drinks. All brought promptly and the way I like them. Waiters, especially Christian, very attentive, anticipates your every move and question. New location is great, crowded but service does not suffer. Will be back many times again.

8stVtgTAIBi6zNG4eclCKA.text: Great dinner!  They accommodated 11 of us and everyone's food came out at the same time, hot, and correct. Loved the Go Green pasta!!  Thanks Fez!!

oySMOkixXHNOfpCs-kIMcA.text: The service was so friendly and attentive that I felt very welcome despite being new to the area and never having been there before. More importantly, everyone was extremely kind to my mother! And most importantly, the food was delicious and unique. I really enjoyed my experience here and will be sure to return soon.

bpAaJBu5KZtw-BctZNyfZw.text: Went for happy hour and dinner on First Friday with some friends. Understandably  the place was packed,  which  I don't mind because they have plenty of seating.  We asked for a table for 4 which we were told would take 45 min. We didn't really pay much attention and proceeded to the bar and actually got some really comfy lounge seating. The place is loud inside,  so I'm happy that we got patio seating.  People really seem to need to let it all out after a long work week :) the rose water martini is tasty and it was not super sweet. Our waiter in that section was great, and the host guy was helpful getting our tab settled. My friend got word that a 5th person would join us so we asked the guy that sat us if we could take an extra chair. He said no.  But we thought he was joking,  then when we started laughing awkwardly he said that all the chairs are accounted for in the system,  so we couldn't have an extra chair. The lady in the table adjacent to us said we could take her extra chair. Our guest didn't arrive before the lady left so we had to give the chair back when the same guy stared us down like we where misbehaving children. For food we had the fries baked,  delicious,  and we also had the flat breads , gyro and chicken.  Gyro was my favorite,  which is weird because I rarely eat lamb, the pizzas / Flatbreads go by a fancy name I can't remember. I also had their watermelon cocktail which comes with a gummy gum worm. Cute! Monica our server was the highlight of the evening. She's fantastic, and I mean it : pleasant, friendly, got us 2 extra chairs because we actually had 6 people, 7 total join us, all while being smiley, and helpful. Absolutely the best service I've ever had. Way to go  Monica!!!

qpTZ55aiNdYYt2BaJQvMPg.text: I recently held a graduation party/30th birthday party at FEZ. Hands down one of the easiest places I've worked with for an event for a larger group. Kirk was very clear on everything and helped make suggestions for drinks and menu items. Everyone had such a great time and it helped that I knew everything was taken care of! They also accommodated food allergies and other dietary needs. Our guests loved the food!  Thank you to all the staff at FEZ for making our event so great!

mthb3PFVUKafYB_ZBxzQCQ.text: Sunday Brunch....   frittata and prosecco with a splash of orange juice makes for a great start to a Sunday xoxo love Fez!!

photos.caption: Photo of FEZ - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Frittata for Brunch LOVE

dnZn9pERMH45d8eU6uPC2g.text: Came here for a late lunch with a friend on a Friday afternoon! This was our second time here and I have to admit that I love this place! They offer an amazing happy hour on Fridays. And although we didn't partake, it's a spot you'd wanna keep in mind for the future. The service is great! Your greeted happily as soon as you walk through the doors and we were met by our waitress within a few minutes of getting seated. I ordered the Caprese Kisra. Oh my goodness. If you're looking for something pretty light yet filing, this is your dish! This flat bread with the oven dried tomatoes, fresh mozzarella, basil pesto and lemon field salad is my fave. So much that both times I've come I've ordered the same dish. And I rarely do that. My friend ordered the go green pasta. That lemony pesto with pasta on the spinach, pasta and vegetables sprinkled with feta! This was a fork full of flavorful goodness! We'll definitely be returning! Like without a doubt!!! You won't be disappointed with your decision to grab a bite to eat here!

photos.caption: Photo of FEZ - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of FEZ - Phoenix, AZ, United States

63eGwARmb9BvhTzbnte6Ww.text: Average at best. Food was good, service was as bad as the last time here. Enjoy eating downtown and love the patio. Arrived early enough the restaurant was empty. However after waiting over 5 minutes for a server I asked if they might inform them they we were here and ready. I was told our waitress was on the phone. I said I assumed she must be busy with the big crowd. The waiter replied good one. When Nora did show up it was with full and complete attitude. Obviously our need for service was an inconvenience. We all suffered through the meal and service. Cool thing for me is my money spends anywhere. Sad that such a great setup and pretty decent food can be ruined by such lousy service. Maybe once the restaurant becomes managed we can try again but that will be a far time in the future.

KBv9AWhEV_Sp8Zx-KWfH0A.text: I enjoyed the patio and most of the food. I ordered the salmon which the dish was slathered on top of everything it came with. So nothing was separated. I ordered appetizers and the calamari was some of the best I've had. Unfortunately at first I tried to order the cheesy cauliflower dip and told by my waitress that the kitchen was out. Only to hear the waiter serving the table behind us shortly give the same dish. I did order it and was very disappointed in the consistency of the mix, less of a dip or cheese expectation. I would eat here again but have to be cautious to be overly specific.

KTrs4CAlby0Nu-r-a0jQkA.text: Fun atmosphere and delicious, creative dishes.  Been for a Sunday late brunch....and friendly weekday dinner gathering.  Friendly service each time, food was hot, fresh and flavor packed. Will definitely return each time we are in the city!

1QMQjdQmQbQtqeCfrjp2CA.text: This was the worst experience I have ever had at a restaurant. It was gay pride day so it was a little busy. However, I saw multiple people show up and get seated before we did. We waited an hour for a seat!!! We saw our waitress twice the whole time we were here. When the food arrived, the person who brought it to us dumped syrup on my sister. The food was horrible their eggs tasted like someone dumped an entire salt shaker into it. The pancakes were ok but nothing worth $10... save your time and money don't go here!!

mECmZvrl-ddDq6sqHQPWYg.text: Came here for Saturday brunch. It was busy but we were able to get a table right away, which was nice. The egg white omelette was tasty. We ordered the "spicy harissa" option but I would probably try something else next time because that option was very oily and not really that spicy. The tomatoes inside were delicious and I loved the simple side salad. It also came with nice crusty toast and jam. I'm glad I shared that plate with my friend because it was a lot of food.  We also got the rosemary fries. I'm not a huge fan of rosemary, but these were really good! It was so many fries, we couldn't even finish but we made a good effort ;)  Would definitely come back for brunch again and maybe try one of their bloody Mary's, which were very reasonably priced.

photos.caption: Photo of FEZ - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Egg white omelette with side salad and giant order of rosemary fries, yum!

MWA1SxhGqzOxUeplm9DShw.text: Had the rosemary chicken sandwich and it was great!! I'm not a big brunch person and opted for a sandwich and turned out way better than I thought. Had some of my girlfriends golden curry egg scramble and it was quite tasty. Service was great. It was a beautiful day and we took a stroll to the Japanese garden that was about 10 minutes away. Great spot for lunch/dinner and a stroll.

photos.caption: Photo of FEZ - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Rosemary chicken sandwich

TgBkGm4lC9vi2L0x35Gt4w.text: FEZ has long been one of my go-to places when in Phoenix. I went to the old location at least once a week back when. I wasn't in Phoenix long on this recent trip, so I opted for delivery from here via Uber Eats. Their salads are so yum. Loaded with goodness and some seriously tasty dressings. And you can certainly never go wrong with their burgers and fries. All perfectly cooked with fabulous fresh toppings. And for delivery, everything was packaged awesomely. No spills or issues or anything.

bCYl3EojEeSqhI68U3HzcQ.text: Downtown Phoenix fantastic foodies dream come True. If you like good food and I mean GOOD food then you have to try FEZ. The menu offerings are items foodies enjoy most but with FEZ flare. Your not going to come here for a typical hamburger and fries the menu is creative. My favorite is the Fit Fez. A signature plate with choice of meat, sauteed veggies, rice and warm pita bread. My last tasty dish was the Fit Fez with a grilled chicken breast. The healthy option for lunch left me full for the day. Now the fries are my favorite appetizer to share. A variety of flavors including cinnamon dusted sweet potatoes fries.   If you need to wash your food down be sure to order a tasty cocktail. This restaurant is known for their tasty drinks and drink specials.   I have never been unhappy or had a bad experience. The wait staff and cooks always have my food prepared as requested. The plates come out beautiful garnished to the "T." I have never encountered a long wait time. I believe a lot of this has to do with FEZ culture. You can tell all staff is happy to be there. The restaurant is always clean not a dirty table in site both inside or outside which goes well with the trendy decor. The price point is reasonable. This is the perfect spot for a traditional meal, date night or friends night out.

photos.caption: Photo of FEZ - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Lemon Aioli Chicken Sandwich withLemon Salad
Photo of FEZ - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fry Basket- Cinnamon Sweet Potato Fries and Garlic Basil
Photo of FEZ - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Meal called &#34;Fit Fez&#34; Blackened Chicken, rice, roasted veggies, Pita bread and dip

ap7bO6Hh4OYUY0QhNMWcVw.text: This place is in a very convenient location and has a lot of charm! They're across the street from the new urban hotel FOUND:RE Phoenix.  You walk in and it's a modern feel with friendly staff. They're attentive even when it's busy! We shared a salad and sandwich and they both were quite good. I don't remember the names of them unfortunately... I will definitely be back!  The only thing is that it's hard to park there at night! I highly recommend riding the light rail to get here. The stop is a 30 second walk from the Restaurant.

CWnSox_kQpLCjiwwfzJ3ug.text: After gorging on Mexican for the weekend, our group was in the mood for something more healthful and light. Also, we were with vegetarians and they wanted a menu that would accommodate them. Few nailed it on all counts. And in terms of accommodation, we had a large group on Labor Day and no reservation. We called ahead and they got us the perfect space.  The hummus was just delicious, with a nice little kick to it. The salads were not swimming in dressing, and the house dressing was a nice vinaigrette. I had the lamb pita and it was just ideal.  Overall we enjoyed it and would definitely recommend it for groups and people burned out on the local Mexican fare -- which is to do, but after three days a change was needed.

wEFBI--Ho8NM7WnsS9RyFA.text: Had a great time here. Waiter was very helpful in picking out food and drinks. They didn't have strawberry lemonade on menu but some were made up for the group. We had a very good time at happy hour. Pets are welcome which is get when you don't want to leave your pup kids at home by themselves. Would return again.

jF_enX0KsTDvQC1Mo6RXrg.text: Super great vibe, food and drinks were fantastic. Our server Austin was very attentive and personable. We will definitely be back!

jbxNHQxqsSwG63PI0M0P6g.text: All the employees were super friendly but our server, Candy, was exceptional. She made the experience so much more enjoyable! Amazing happy hour, great patio, delicious food. We will definitely be back!

5Wrp1rPNQHqLnHVwekGPxQ.text: I like that you can substitute any regular burger with a black bean patty. The service is good and consistent. They also deliver!

zucDc1XuEsuztlsNMLNEHQ.text: Was your white VW hit while you were eating here on 1/22 about noon? I saw a Jeep hit it and have details for you. I also left info w/ the FEZ staff and they said they would pass the info to you if you went in and mentioned it. Feel free to Message me.   FEZ is awesome. All the food I've eaten and seen comes out tasting and looking awesome. If you're near, stop in.

fky6eGUb_e-_Z3RyHKOLnQ.text: Good vegan curry. Also like the shrimp and rice dish I had. A little pricey if you order through Uber eats but was still awesome.

Photo of FEZ - Phoenix, AZ, United States

xluIqkaRZMq2zTjDC8TPhA.text: Came here for lunch and drinks on a Sunday afternoon with a group of 5 and immediately got questionable service. We weren't given menus with the excuse of the host having just left. We asked about drink specials and were told it was happy hour so we all ordered cocktails.  The 5 cocktails took roughly 20 minutes to come to the table and were served one at a time with another excuse that they were down a bartender. The food was actually pretty good but paired with not receiving silverware, awkward service, and confusing excuses, it didn't really make up for the experience.  At the end, we received our checks with all the drinks at full price and were told that they had no way to adjust the pricing.  We eventually got to speak to a manager to discuss the discrepancies and he ended up taking the drinks off the check.  Working with a short staff is hard, but I feel like some steps could've been taken along the way to make our experience more enjoyable, however I don't think we will be back.

py4-Tsjn8Ey0km33-GJJNQ.text: We've always been fans of FEZ, dating back to when they were in the location farther north on Central that shared the parking lot with the FedEx store.  I have to say, I feel like both the food and the atmosphere has only gotten better since they moved farther south to the new location at Central and Portland.  We've been here several times in the past 6 months, ranging from a few girls' nights to a family brunch and have been more than satisfied on each visit.  Plus, the parking is much improved over the previous location.  Menu favorites include the strawberry blueberry cashew salad with chicken, the FEZ fries, the lamb sliders, calamari that stayed crispy even after it had cooled (our fault, due to lengthy conversation), pesto caesar salad, and my favorite brunch item, the FEZ omelette, with a generous serving of gyro meat tucked in the eggs.  They have a tasty house red and very good brunch cocktails.  The only thing that keeps us from being more frequent visitors is the drive into downtown.  Wish they might consider expansion westward, either to the Westgate entertainment district or to the Estrella Falls mall project, if it ever launches.

cqExaIhKpoSaPz9orb5Fww.text: We LOVE Fez! May it be happy hour, dinner, or brunch. The "new" location has a great patio and a nice park to walk around after eating.  The BEST Sunday champagne brunch around. The servers are always so friendly, and the atmosphere is always fun. Everyone we bring here ends up loving it! Always a good time when we eat or drink at Fez.

HnIWtHAN_q4RyC0BEPSrvQ.text: Good dinner right across the street from my hotel. Stopped in around 9pm and was seated outside right away. I had the Tangier Burger on gluten free bread, and my partner had the mozzarella salad. The burger was perfectly cooked and the bread was amazing. I wasn't expecting hummus on a burger to work so well! My partner's salad was also very tasty. The cocktails were good, a bit on the sweet side. Service was OK. Overall, a nice spot.

V8sP0mKmOqjFcWkiRcgMQA.text: If I had to describe the food in one word, it would be 'generic'. The interior is certainly nice, and it is located the most prime of locations, but the food itself did not leave much of an impression on me, and it was considerably more expensive than it should have been. With so many great options in the downtown Phoenix area, I have not felt a compelling desire to return here.

nimNn17-GhLABQB6zfDYYw.text: Loved FEZ! The food was delicious. My cocktail was yummy. And our server, Fabian was a doll. I will definitely be back soon.

wMZw19DDKwjjtx7Fkiof9w.text: Always mediocre in my eyes. Foods always just blah.. decent brunch menu for weekends though.

_FAVPZiMQhMSeHwRGRQ_qA.text: You MUST try the Spice Road Chicken Sandwich. I have never tasted something so tasty and spicy. The service was great. I came in to place a to go order and even then the waitress was attentive. I definitely recommend for a quick lunch date.

NSJUPy8EfeFwR95Fup89jA.text: Came to FEZ for the first time tonight. I was really excited, as my friends had been talking it up all night. I ordered the FEZ burger and spicy harissa fries. The burger was great, the fries left something to be desired. Our server, while very cute, was not attentive once a table filled with people ordering alcohol sat down. In fact, he passed by us six times before asking if he needs anything additional, forgetting that my friend had asked for more ketchup, and we all needed refills on our drinks. By the time he acknowledged us again, we had all finished our food, except for my fries, which were pretty inedible. Once we paid, we were given incorrect change back. They rounded down. At that point, I was just ready to leave. A very disappointing end to what could have been a great experience in a nice setting.

3z8iBnNHPv0niEdimfHA5Q.text: Simply delicious food inspired by the Mediterranean Middle East. Fez salad is my go-to. The hummus and pita are a notch above anywhere else in town. A funky mid-century decor announces that this is Middle Eastern with a twist--a twist of lime to go with that cocktail.

m6Z79KsYlt79smEZGhPDuQ.text: My friend suggested this restaurant, as we were headed downtown for a concert. The restaurant is too noisy for words. We were shouting at each other during the entire course of the meal; therefore, I left with a headache. I added chicken to the Pesto Caesar Salad (with toasted pistachio nuts, parmesan cheese and spiky croutons). The salad was drenched in cheese and there was no pesto to be found (not even on the chicken). I cook with pesto and enjoy it. We were in a time crunch, so I didn't make an issue of it. The three others were satisfied with what they ordered. We did not enjoy the noise level and will only return if we can sit outside. So, I was disappointed. How can you enjoy a meal with friends, if you are shouting at each other? Phoenix has many restaurant choices, this is not one of them.

_6NBngMb5wLqa7SmEtJWuQ.text: The food was amazing.. the staff was top-notch and bartender handsome Lucas very attentive..He was amazing.. The atmosphere awesome.. I'll be back... Carlton from NYC

FiY8AW5nAqlfB1RWldoCFQ.text: The wait staff is always friendly and the food is consistent and always delicious. Love the lamb sliders! The cheese plate is beyond good too!

QobQYKE3ciYXL31WJgVrlw.text: Meal was good. A little overpriced. A lot of items on the menu had no protein but you could add one at "market price", for chicken was $4.95. That's a bit much. Probably won't return. Not the best meal I've had in Phoenix!

Ic5aJCp56Qlo8Uw-H_PRZQ.text: Super cute scene!!! Amazing brunch options as well as drink options! I tried a few things that were questionable but others are amazing! It really depends what you order so give it more than once chance!

Poerm65EeNAtTeTSVdtZsQ.text: Love this place. In the bar, Luke is the most attentive awesome mixology bartender & waiter dude! Ginger & I think he's just awesome! Great food & drink!!!

V76diEeCMhmBdo-j-i6uxA.text: I am absolutely in love with Fez and their staff. I have been coming here since 2011 and am still coming. My boyfriend and I usually come on Monday & Tuesday for their Margarita and Martini specials. Every single time we come, we are usually treated like family or old friends. Delicious food as always. I will continue to come here for years to come!

WfibaWWMzgeJCJSOnKDUhQ.text: Feztastic!  Sunday drink specials-how can you go wrong with the G Spot and Peach Bellini to start your day.  Breakfast of Champions!  While most diners were enjoying breakfast-all looking delish- my hubby and I dove into a decadent lunch.  Best Sweet Potato Fries on this planet!  This is the only place I have ever gotten a CRISPY SPF-they are usually limp at other places.  I opted for my fave sammie ever-the Rosemary Chix (screaming with flavor) and my hubby chose the Balsamic Bleu Burger!  All the accoutrements make the sandwiches divine-like no other in town.  The Ciabatta is always soft and chewy.  Our service was fab-and the energy in the restaurant upbeat.  Tables full of laughing, happy diners filled Fez.

p5HJvYLhKrqOLzPg97S3BA.text: Excellent Mediterranean take on traditional American fare. Chicken phyllo appetizer could have been a meal!  Casablanca chicken sandwich had some great new flavors for me. I thought they'd be overwhelming but it worked perfect. Would definitely come again.

w6mAPq8Luv8VSQdFzPs9_g.text: Two words - Breakfast Pasta!  Wife and I stopped by before going to an afternoon Phoenix Symphony Event.  Called ahead to make reservations and had a nice booth.  I would recommend making a reservation as Fez is really popular.  Brian was our server and did a good job of keeping us filled and satisfied.  After looking over the varied Breakfast Brunch options I choose  their Breakfast Pasta on a whim.  The menu description was intriguing - penne pasta tossed with sauteed linguica sausage, pepadew peppers, red onion, bacon & tossed with creamy scrambled egg; topped with parmesan cheese".  Whoa this is now a favorite (my wife told me I won the brunch wars today after I shared several bites).  The eggs were perfected blended into pasta and the flavors all worked really well together. The sweetness of the peppers were a good contrast to the savory sausage and bacon.  The ample bowl allowed us to linger and watch the eclectic clientele.  Very diverse crowd who all seemed to enjoy their meals.  We are definitely going back.

photos.caption: Photo of FEZ - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Breakfast Pasta - totally yuumy!

7mhq8-zNL0hBICB5gB5bkA.text: The mimosas here was hands down the best I've ever had, no seriously! Not to mention the cereal shot, mmmmm. Hubby had a bloody Mary that was off the hook. For my meal I cautiously ordered the curry which turned out to be one of the best curry's ever! Light, creamy, fresh veggies and eggs that are oh so fluffy. Such a happy girl right now.  Run there if you've never been to this restaurant with a cool urban vibe and outdoor seating areas.

-hlyHvoGPffZmHAFG3SyOg.text: First time eating here. Their entire menu is enticing. I tried the Blackberry Basil Martini and it was delicious! Their lettuce wraps were delicious and had cherries and dates, pears and chicken. The Caesar salad is amazing solely for the pistachios that are on top. Guess what I have been doing with my salads now, yup; adding pistachios! Great service, will defintely be back.

2YNmRxmwONYcEUhuDWVV5A.text: Love this place.  Been going here for years even when they were at the old location on Central near Indian School.  The food is great.  Patrons are friendly and the wait staff are incredible and attentive.

q6l-h-FVb8OCqQrMfHiP-g.text: Still great people great food. Love the chicken strips and my favorite drink is the G Spot. Which is on special on Thursdays. They have a great brunch Saturday and Sundays till three. Happy hour every day from 4:00 to 6:30. Same great owners of Switch and Peoples Pizza Pub you should try them as well. north on central. Dont hesitate because of parking  there is a puplic free  garage in back. What makes this place so great is the people who work here and the owners who always are engaging. Its five star all the way around.

photos.caption: Photo of FEZ - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Open patio in front
Photo of FEZ - Phoenix, AZ, United States. New round bar deco wall hanging lights.
Photo of FEZ - Phoenix, AZ, United States. As wonderful as before! Its Martini Tuesdsy. A few new items on the menu great decore same great bartenders.

0q9-QOL9sVG7LhGkwGzUDA.text: Love Fez even before they move to new location. As I do love modern things this place fit nicely into that description. Food is good and this place get varity of patrons. Gives that city hip feeling, which is something Phoenix is still trying to catch up to what I called "True big cities" culture.  I def would recommend this place. It will fit for dating place as well. Also it is near the Phoenix Art Walk so you can have dinner here and burn those calories after ingesting yummy food.

n4X8WBfRTD96lnNfrZsBSg.text: Very nice and friendly staff! Food was delicious (a little bit expensive I think) but it was great!   I ate Barcelona Salad with chicken and Cinnamon Sweet Potatoe fries!

photos.caption: Photo of FEZ - Phoenix, AZ, United States

3XSO1dXT6XW4fvnPt90BYg.text: What can I say? Hmmm.... FEZ is a happy place, they have a hipster vibe, it almost seems like the happening place to be in this part of town. My visit to the establishment was run of the mill: I stayed close by, it was a short walk.   The customer service was slow and it was due in large to the sheer volume of people at this place ( it was close to Fire Marshall shut down full). When I recognize this situation I typically order drinks and the meal together to help all out.     I ordered the FEZ burger, spicy fries and a margarita. The burger was said to be and I quote "wildly popular" my taste buds relayed to my brain and mouth average at best. The spicy fries were good but they really are ensuring my waistline does not grow as the portion size was small.  The margarita was needle point sharp good! Wow that damn thing was amazing!   I sat outside because the weather was perfect: I like to people watch and it was noisy inside plus I had my latest book with me. With the large volume of people the slow service and small portion sizes I have to rate this place three stars.  I have nothing against the LGBT community as my motto for the most part is live and let live: except when I see crimes against women and children and other violence. FEZ  is supported well by the gay community, there were tons of couples on dates and quite a few of the waiters and waitresses appeared to be apart of the community, so if you're not at a place of accepting others different than you I would not partake of this place. I mean no harm or ill will.   Take it easy breezy!

photos.caption: Photo of FEZ - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Watermelon margarita

EGwjkkxTncqp6BNlt-9OGg.text: I stoped in for brunch today & It was absolutely amazing. AS ALWAYS. The ambiance at this restaurant is extremely laid back. The service is good and they are always on top of it. Servers are well versed on the menu and always offer up suggestions. I always shoot for the rosemary chicken sandwich with no feta and it never fails me! Sandwiches come with a side salad or the choice to upgrade to frys. This establishment is always clean and extremely welcoming to new customers. Their breakfast menu has just about everything you could ask for from Omelets to hash and eggs, they have drink specials absolutely every day of week & food you won't want to miss out on. Fez is a downtown staple and makes every customer feel like a new friend! They are also offering these new infusions, I had one today that consists of bourbon, walnuts and some other ingredients and it was great!! The bartender told us exactly how it should be served and accommodated my special request to have it served over ice with a slice of lemon and I couldn't have been happier. I'll be back soon!!

photos.caption: Photo of FEZ - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Started with mimosas
Photo of FEZ - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Egg whites, bacon, red potatoes and toast
Photo of FEZ - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Rosemary chicken sandwich no feta

JIbM8bjQVpTW8wGqq-J6Yw.text: Wow! Thoroughly impressed. Brian was our server and he was extremely patient and helpful with the menu as it was our 1st time there. Since it was mothers day, my mom and I decided to check this out before the museum and we LOVED it. We did the Fez burger which Brian suggested and although the feta cheese, pears and molasses sauce sounded weird, he assured us it was delicious and it was. We also tried the Barcelona bibb salad...yum. Candied cashews and feta with onions. So good. My niece had a pita gyro and she also loved it. We tried the chips and salsa with guacamole for an app as well. Top a this off with a couple peach bellinis and we really had a fantastic meal, great service and such a nice time. Cant wait to go back!

QRbmNWwMzAjK3qjgnFLYzQ.text: Went to FEZ this week for the first time n I will be back. The restaurant has a great vibe n the food and service are just as cool.   I had a fairly new dish for them and I ate every single bite.  Besides the food they have an awesome variety of Martinis. Tuesday night they have a martini special but I was there on a Wednesday. Still worth the price.  Finally the staff was amazing and they went out of their way ( or seem like they did) to serve and provide the best costumer service I have seen in Phoenix. You Rock Alley!!!  Keep it going.

74XW5ZC_sSnkO4gFRU1I8w.text: Great happy hour menu, the atmosphere is pretty relaxed and I like the mid century design. Must try the martinis, there's a large selection and they're fun and sweet!

2a2MfFA9w8_ubEOetdjGnw.text: This place has a great ambiance and a friendly staff of hot guys. It is listed under gay establishments but doesn't appear to be a gay bar when you walk in. The cocktails run around ten dollars and I wasn't looking to spend the kind of money. My friend seemed to enjoy his. My chicken strips were decent and something you can probably make better at home. It was good for what it was...bar food.

photos.caption: Photo of FEZ - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken strips with some great aoili

ZrsA1x6a4lefyu1z1eGKpg.text: Fez is one of my favorite locations in the art district.  When they moved to Central and Roosevelt about a year and a half ago I quickly became a regular.  The food is great, the staff is amazing and the central location is idea for starting or ending your night.  Sometimes in my case both.  The food is great, the staff is amazing and surprisingly stable for a restaurant.  The low turnover shows how great of a place it is and makes it easy for you to build a relationship with them if you're regular.

Ru9ytcWKEo47Z8JHYfj22w.text: The service and the food are always fantastic. I love the FEZ burger and sweet potato fries with apricot aioli! The FEZ salad and the chicken strips are also fantastic. Haven't tried anything I didn't like yet. If you haven't tried it yet go for it. You will not be disappointed!

aBwQw_I3sToCZ2IurZOWFA.text: We ended up here late at night - we were able to catch late night happy hour. $2 off margaritas and cheap appetizers were perfect. We sat at the bar and the bartenders were friendly and attentive. Will definitely go back for the watermelon margarita!

FziCx86xZFGKrJ7N7hZTYw.text: Ok so loved the old FEZ, and my best friend had me meet him here and neglected to tell me it moved. Thank sweet baby Jesus for GPS! So after driving around completely confused for about 5 minutes I found it and the new FEZ is beautiful! I mean the inside is just gorgeous... Now that I have gotten that out of the way let's move to my next favorite the food is amazing, I've tried a couple of different dishes and appetizers and EVERYTIME it was a hit.   The service is good too attentive but not annoying, informative but not pushy, friendly but not the Gawd what kind of drugs are they on kind of friendly either... So to me the service is the perfect balance.   And my fav is the drinks !!  I went on Tini Tuesday and the certain Martinis where $4 and they were yummy and strong, so much so that after two I had to crash at a nearby friends house!   We did get dessert the last time and I wasn't wow'd, but then again I'm supposed to be on a diet so I wasn't supposed to get desert lol!  The verdict: great food, great service, amazing drinks and good prices! Go there like now !!!

photos.caption: Photo of FEZ - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Watermelon Martinis and dessert ....

ipG_gdjeh324fhZTkX3vtA.text: Applebees meet kebab. This uber trendy restaurant has a fusion Turkish meets America menu. The service was very nice but the food and drinks were just not good. It's not often I get sick after going out.  I ordered a mojo-tini which was undrinkable, cheap syrup with rhum and a half leaf of mint floating in a sugar coated martini glass. The gyro pizza had fresh salad on it but the pita was heavy and gyro was just salty undefined meat.  If you want to look good and lost your taste buds but have a solid stomach, consider this place.

QZgz-wCW2VauuQHS2ate1A.text: Awesome burgers and side salad that makes you forget about fries. Friendly service. New location is in a nicer part of phx.

G_cEruiJfbBGvXduacTueA.text: Went here for drinks...they have a $5 special and it was okay. Shortly after we sat down, a pub crawl arrived and made it kind of a madhouse. The service was good considering how crazy it got in there. One thing that kind of bugged me was I paid in cash and he didn't bring back change or ask me if I needed change. Just took my cash and assumed the change was his tip (even though the change was way over 20%). He might have just been flustered with the influx of customers due to the pub crawl but that's kind of a big mistake.

AH5sxpFBZ-PDD6BD0g8m5g.text: I love this place! My girlfriend and I go here almost every week. Mondays and Tuesdays have amazing drink specials. Monday is $4 margaritas, Tuesday is $4 martinis. If you go, you need to try the Fez Burger. It's to die for. Every time I go, the service is spectacular. The servers are super friendly, and fun. This is easily my favorite spot in Phoenix. We're always treated like fam here.

dcqq4LZbx74p2C2Uiy3rig.text: Not what I expected. Nothing wrong with being gay. But it looks like you have to be gay to have good service

6FQW4bl1ksLiFZR2bg2Cig.text: The outdoor seating with a heating post above most tables added a nice touch. Unfortunately our table didn't have one so we were for the most part feeling slightly chilly. Our waiter Austin was very nice and personable by making an effort to connect with us. He also gave us some great recommendations. Food was very good. Best part of the meal was the roasted vegetables, which the whole party I was with agreed it was just superb. Grilled and seasoned to perfection. The lamb sliders for my Fez Fit was surprisingly small portioned given it was an extra $4. I'd say stick with the chicken or gyro strip option. The whole plate was decently filling though given my huge appetite. Dessert was just amazing. Try the carrot cake drizzled with caramel for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of FEZ - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Lamb sliders platter with side of guac

UqrwAlnTkKtqYHgIXVb5iA.text: I'd been to FEZ several times in the past but had yet to review it! This time we arrived for dinner around 5:20pm on a Saturday, there were plenty of empty tables outside and inside, although there were some that were reserved for parties who had yet to arrive. We were seated at a hi top by the bar immediately.   The host was super friendly, and eventually the bartender came over to give us water and take our drink orders. Our apparent waiter appeared a bit after and asked if we wanted anything else? No introduction so it was a bit awkward, but he took our food order for us and later dropped off the check after awhile. Another waitress picked up the check though, so I'm not sure if our guy was overloaded with tables or what. But I've never had an issue with service before so I won't count it against them.   Onto the food! I ordered the grilled chicken pita and my girlfriend got the All American burger with an added side of fries.   The grilled chicken pita was amazing... apple, onion, dried pear, dates, goat cheese and pomegranate vinaigrette. The flavor combination was perfect and the portion size was just right. I stuck with the small salad that comes with the meal which had a tasty dressing.   The burger was good, it's on ciabatta bread instead of a traditional bun, so it looks more like a burger sandwich, but was good!! The salt and pepper fries were classic and tasty.   The ambiance is funky and modern and I liked that the chairs for the hi top tables had small backs to them, makes them so much more comfortable than the usual stools places will have. Definitely a cool place to hang out!

photos.caption: Photo of FEZ - Phoenix, AZ, United States. All american burger added side of fries
Photo of FEZ - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Grilled chicken pita

2C33hUCl1QUyx0cKlh1Thg.text: I've been here so many times now and I love it! Great service every time. They are amazing here, super organized, wait staff is always so professional. The food is also a 10/10, I love that they have a bit of everything. I love the Greek spin on American classics. The prices are fair and worth it. The sharables are perfect portions and you get plenty. Great for a lunch date with family or a night out with friends. It's hard to find a good place to drink with actually great tasting food!

photos.caption: Photo of FEZ - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Spicy Nacho Burger
Photo of FEZ - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Baja Chicken tacos (can also order beef)
Photo of FEZ - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fez Feta Fries est. $9 (green onion, feta, ranch, and diced tomatoes)

M9hKP6jkDxTeIAM3RCVP_w.text: My only complaint about FEZ is that it's not walking distance from my home. Seriously, I could never get tired of this place. The restaurant is always clean with great service.  Burgers are always a very safe bet, but if you're there for brunch on a weekend, I definitely recommend the breakfast burrito, especially if you have a big appetite. I'm notorious for always finishing my food (and sometimes others') and I struggled to get it all down.

V9qMK6_by44oGjOC1kbFKQ.text: Fez is such a great place to go to with friends! It was a group of 6 and we had a whole back corner to ourselves! Our server was really friendly and accommodating which worked really well for my friends & I. We get there in time for happy hour and they had $5 margaritas. My friend ordered the strawberry one and I got a taste and whoah it was overwhelmingly sweet! Plus the drink came in a basic cup(presentation was lame) so I decided to skip on it. As for food I ordered the Romana adobo which was delicious! Even the garlic bread was something to rave about! However, when I got the check I was a bit surprised. It was practically $6 to add chicken which I had, but didn't realize it would be that pricey. $25 for a plate of pasta is bit TOO much in my opinion. It was very tasty but honestly not worth that price. The overall ambience of FEZ is great and totally worth coming back too!

cp9Tn1aRsubJ5UXbSOUxMw.text: I went here the other day for lunch before going to the airport with my folks and my dog. I saw on a website that this place was supposed to be dog friendly. The waitstaff was not very friendly at all and the blonde woman had a weird bad attitude when my dad asked for lemon slices for his water. The server also forgot some of our food we ordered and just seemed really out of it and gave off a cold attitude.  There were only 2 or 3 other tables of people outside. Its the sort of place that tries hard to be "cool" looking and just ends up looking tacky. The food was okay, nothing special. Won't be going back.

QC0GNPd_VM-_BKqvVX43Kw.text: We ate here last night, and although the decor was cute and the atmosphere was hip and fun, I felt like the food was really lackluster. So you're basically paying to sit and eat in a  cute restaurant but food that you could get the same thing somewhere else for a lot less. And we were not impressed with the cinnamon and sugar sprinkles on our french fries... blech.

3dwtiAcKRB6unbMV5auMdg.text: Had never heard of this place, but the food was surprisingly decent. I went on a Sunday, they have a brunch menu. Decided to get the Fez Omelette. Delish, and so big I only ended up eating half. Had the rest for dinner because I was so full.  Also decided in the Spicy Jalapeno Bloody Mary. I was warned that it would be hot, but I could have used a little more heat. But then again, I breathe fire, so don't go by me. If love to try this place again during the week for the rest of their menu. So I'll be back.

photos.caption: Photo of FEZ - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fez Omelette, it&#39;s REALLY creamy (goat cheese). Comes with a side salad and bread. Good, but not sure it get it again.

_1pKFLJgePJGT349dGpJsg.text: Definitely, the place to go for Margarita Mondays! they are $5 and come in all kinds of delicious flavors. My favorite ones are the mango and pomegranate margaritas. Good service and quality food, I usually go there for their tasty salads like the strawberry Mediterranean one.

photos.caption: Photo of FEZ - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Margaritas are the best!

9UFWrjoITUNHC-2Zfim0LQ.text: This is mainly a review of their catering service.  This week I had a holiday potluck and needed something quick. The place I work gets their large catering platters for events sometimes and they are decent.   So, I called at noon on the day I needed it and asked if there was any way they could make me the $30 hummus party platter (hummus, veggies and bread) for pick up at 5:30pm that day.  The guy confirmed with someone and came back on the phone and said yes. He took my name and number and confirmed what I wanted and the 5:30 pick up time (twice).   I arrived at 5:35. I told the guy that first approached that I was there to pick up a hummus platter to-go.  He disappears into the kitchen area, comes out, indicates they are packaging it up and then roams around taking care of his tables.   So I wait. And wait. About 10 minutes later another guy approaches me and tells me that they didn't have any record of my order but could put it together for me.   Seriously? I told him no thanks and left! I had to be at the potluck at 6 and didn't have time to wait.  I had a similar experience with catering here before. I came to pick up a large order of catering platters for a colleague for an event we had and arrived at the set pick up time. Although they did have the order, it took them 20 minutes to get it packaged and to my car.   I'm sorry - but if I specify a specific pick up time (in order for food to stay hot as long as possible and with travel time to get back to event and set it up, etc) I expect it to be packaged and ready to go at that time.  Call me crazy.   I will not be using them again. There are other competent places in the area - Pita Jungle, Postino's, etc.

2UBBYH6xu4PR8tMgbFqjfQ.text: I don't have anything bad to say about this place, but if given the choice to brunch elsewhere, I'd brunch elsewhere- strictly based on the menu items. There's pretty standard fare including eggs, pancakes, salad and sausage items. However if you're looking to bring home leftovers, this is your place! Portion sizes are incredibly generous.

photos.caption: Photo of FEZ - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Photo of FEZ - Phoenix, AZ, United States

CT6n9khduPpN9EKDJ2sW1A.text: This is hands down one of my Phoenix go-to spots. Great patio and atmosphere. Good brunch specials and happy hour specials too. Plus you're in the heart of the city so you can bar hop down Roosevelt after if you're in the mood!

tM82Cktejz8cEzBBSjWHwA.text: First time here, heard about this place a lot and is pretty new for what I tend to gravitate towards to but wasn't disappointed! The rosemary chicken sandwich is one of the simpler options on the menu but for sure grabbed my attention. I wanted to start off slow, but I would go back just for that sandwich. I can only imagine what the other choices taste like

5OrApg2KzuA4ZXjyBBKo9g.text: Food... totally awesome! Had the salmon and a salad.  Both were excellent.  Highly recommend the FEZ.    Location.... love the new location.  First time back in PHX in a few years and the location on Portland St. is great.  Service... well, average with attitude.... slow bar service and not very helpful server (sorry, but I'm used to really great service at restaurants). Could understand if it was a busy night, but a slow weeknight... oh well...    Will be back because the food is really excellent!

95n2rVurjuQ8KWmkxeir6Q.text: Love this place!  Always one of my top spots to go when headed down town. The drinks are always on point, the staff is super friendly and accommodating, and the fez burger has well EARNED it's fabulous reputation.  There's nothing yet I have had on their menu that I haven't immediately loved.

ILpxi47g3sHN-avoYypqHQ.text: 1st time, interesting menu. Had the FEZ burger was pretty good, very unique flavor. Went around closing time wasnt too packed. Server was friendly.

I3uZC2rbz7XvGJCsEQyggw.text: Love Fez...  had a small group from out of town, 6 people.  Fez didn't honor the lunch reservation and although there were plenty of seats, said it would be a 30 minute wait to be seated and longer for the food.  Host said the kitchen was overwhelmed.  This was a first for me and my normal experience here.  May be time for a new lunch go to place.

Etra4xYaBeDuOisuk8VH_g.text: Reliably good food. Highly competent service. Fries are the star. Any sandwich can be ordered lettuce-wrapped -- love! Garage parking is easy. Every so often the menu changes: so far, so good.

2PoDnPLx_8NiteD3e_7krg.text: Eh this place was just ok at best. The cauliflower cheese dip Was more like yellow rice cauliflower served with pita bread. It was super dry, bland and not sure how they can even classify it as a dip. The rest of the food was just ok. The salads came pretty dry, so we asked for some more dressing...don't ask for it because they charge you for dressing! You are charged for it and the salad barely came with any on it. The decor was nice! Don't really need to return but the restaurant across the street looks good! I think we will try that next!

2GkfLZNBom3AYGEpPiVU-Q.text: I had the Golden Curry and it was soo good! It was my first time trying a vegan dish and it was really great. I actually added chicken and it was kinda of expensive (5.50) so I recommend you get the curry by itself. Also the service was nice and fast so I recommend this place!

eLbr3CVtFPzls4twiLlIcQ.text: We LOVE christian!! He is amazing and knows how to be a great waiter.  Best in Phoenix!!  Our food was pretty good, hummus (get the regular kind);  bruschetta (didnt like); fez burger (unique party in my friends mouth); d burger (mike's had better); birthday party dessert (awesome!!); hibiscus drink(yum); roca patron (yes yes yes!!)

qeWMWrsKRE0bJJT1zWM23w.text: Went there at 1p after on a Tuesday after the holiday. The service was terribly slow. Our server was talking to some other table for a long period of time. We figured our waitress (Marissa?) was flirting and trying to impress the dude sitting there. Then some random guy who I'm not sure was a host or a bartender came to over to our table way too close to what I assume was to possibly pick up some of the empty plates, which we didn't have. The only issue with that was that he said nothing. He literally walked over, looked over the table then walked away. It was weird.   Service aside, the food was so good. I was on a lunch break and couldn't get a drink but my friends said that the Martinis were delicious. We all loved what we got. I thought I was ordering garlic Rosemary fries but they seemed to only be salt/pepper/Rosemary. They were still so good. I also got the all american burger. It wasn't really medium like I ordered but the patty was juicy and made up for that.   I'm definitely going to try it again to see if maybe I went on a weird off day.

photos.caption: Photo of FEZ - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The All American burger with fries.

qq1uAORCnAVdtwJ1F-_eRA.text: I discovered the baja tacos and I come for them pretty often. Tacos seem to be getting smaller these days and these are the new size but are sooo good. The pomegranate sauce it was makes them great! Cute restaurant, a little pricy and has Pepsi products (yuck!) but always great service and nice location.

photos.caption: Photo of FEZ - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Baja tacos and hummus. Mmmmmmmm

FM_--ku5WfSmLLDNV-h4Nw.text: We had a great time here on Friday night.  The ambiance was very nice.  The service was good.  My girl picked out this place and she seems to do a better job than I of picking fun places.  I ordered the pasta con spago alla norma with shrimp.  It was very tasty and delicious.  Way better than the Italian speciality restaurant we tried last week. :)  My girl ordered the bacon mushroom bistro steak (medium) with the mushroom sauce on the side.  It turns out the steak was very tasty without the mushroom sauce.  We shared everything.  As for drinks I ordered the strawberry margarita.  The drink had decent strength but had no flavor to it.  It tasted like liquor mixed with sugared water.  I can overlook that.   We both enjoyed our dinners very much and had a great time.  Can't wait to try it again.

5pd_7koag_NTXTpLrmVIQw.text: This place is a Go To every time I'm in Phoenix. Everything on the menu is just delicious and a good amount of it is on the healthier side of things. Drinks are unique and most are amazing!   Get the Lamb Sliders!! Wow!   Also if Chad is around, best server I have had in a super long time!

AE_6k9HhtRURH6JqDZfg9A.text: This is what I had.... duxelles burger... 1/2 # grilled angus burger with finely diced & sauteed mushrooms, onions, swiss cheese, whole grain mustard & roma tomatoes. It was pretty good.... I thought I tasted wasabi in it though which even though I am not a big fan of... can't handle that heat.... it wasn't overpowering and was amazing. My friend had the chicken strip and fry special which she couldn't even finish. The tenders were good... i had a couple and the fries were omg amazing. Sweet potato fries dusted in cinnamon and served with an amazing dipping sauce. Prices are about $10-$15 a person and serving sizes are decent.

jWL5m5z_Cu_7hQQfpNfhlQ.text: I realize how hypocritical I may sound, but honestly the previous location,  I always without a doubt had the best experience  It could have been circumstantial as Managers do not create the environment no do they prepare the meals, or beverages.  I believe in supporting my community by choosing restaurants that are going to provide me the best experience and where I'm going to be able to be myself comfortably -   I brought a good friend she was visiting from San Diego and I was honestly giving Fez another chance.  We were sat on the patio and X-, our Server was delightful and accommodating, he always had our beverage filled and the flow of meal and service was so in sync, it was nice to just take in everything and relax So choose for yourself as for me I'll be back even if I run into mr snarky pants.

tFYVWnFLhS98JQ7OeOOJbw.text: Right off of the light rail stop at Central & Roosevelt this location is much better than the previous. The foods still on par & staff helpful & cool. Can't beat happy hour specials & late night menu. Go & enjoy you won't be sorry.

BJoWvC-cUx2EwoZRxk2YoQ.text: Went here on Saturday night and the food and service were both excellent. My only issue was that my friend and I both ordered absolut martinis and we discussed later that we were fairly certain the vodka they gave us wasn't absolut. It was very harsh. Could have been an honest mistake and we didn't really think about it until later so we couldn't address it.   Other than that I enjoyed everything and so did the two others I was with. My friend had a side of spicy fries with his burger. I tasted them and WOW. Best fries I've ever had. They were not greasy and had the perfect kick to them. I ordered a pesto Caesar salad which was very fresh and there was not even one piece of wilted lettuce (I'm a snob about fresh lettuce in a salad which is why I tend to avoid them but I took a chance here and it paid off).  We enjoyed it so much we came back later to have another drink at the bar. I think the bartenders name was Lindsey and she was fabulous. Very friendly and made a delicious lemon martini. I will come back next time I'm in Phoenix for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of FEZ - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pesto Caesar, calamari, and absolut(?) martinis

J7H9QGB09lFrmbvH_ZL3Pw.text: Alright, lets get something out of the way.  Prior to visiting FEZ's new location, I read the early reviews.  Most of the early negative reviews centered around a poorly handled Facebook conflict with a customer.  I didn't see the Facebook snafu for myself, but I agree disabling Facebook comments is lame way to dodge the issue.  Still, my hope is that FEZ's social media guru (and their staff in general) learned from the incident.  For the sake of this Yelp review, I'm not taking that incident into account because I don't believe its fair for me to judge a business on something I didn't witness myself.  Now then, let's get down to business.  I've been to FEZ's old location a number of times and I was a fan of their food and of their staff.  When I heard that they were going to be taking over the vacated restaurant space on Central and Portland (formerly occupied by Portland's Wine Bar), I was ecstatic.  The location could not be more tailor made for a restaurant like FEZ.  Its an urban location that meshes perfectly with FEZ's urban vibe.  Plus its just a few miles south of the old location, making it accessible to their loyal customers and newly accessible to the Downtown work and happy hour crowd.  The only question for me was whether FEZ would retain the same charm and quality.  If my first visit is any indication, my answer is emphatically yes.  The remodel of this restaurant space has done wonders to liven up this corner of Central and Portland.  Both the interior and exterior space of the restaurant make  ample use of the space to pack in the patrons, while at the same time not making it feel overcrowded.  I came here with a friend on a Friday night around 5pm.  We were greeted and sat immediately (decided to sit inside tonight as it was a little chilly outside).  The menu is exactly as I remember it, with a wide kaleidoscope of items to choose from but most famously including their burgers and fries.  To ensure that the food was just as good I remembered, I went with an old standby.  A FEZ Burger and some of their famous cinnamon sweet potato fries.  Got a glass of red wine to go with it.  My friend got a half salad as she wasn't very hungry.  The food is just as good as I remember from their old location.  A medium burger topped with honey bbq sauce, pears (yes pears), feta, onions, and a garlic aioli.  A heavenly burger to be sure.  Their sweet potato fries are dusted with cinnamon and come with a deliciously savory sauce mixture on the side.  Again, great combination of flavors that almost made the fries taste like a dessert.  So now to the negative part of my review about FEZ that pretty much carries over from its old location.  The prices.  Total tab for a FEZ burger, fries, a glass of wine, tax and tip came to about $28.  Don't get me wrong, this isn't your normal burger and fries, but still not cheap.  The only other compliant I would register is that the interior acoustics are such that it can get really loud inside when its full.  Still, taken as a whole, FEZ is an excellent addition to the neighborhood and a terrific spot for happy hour after work.  Their old location garnered an average of about 4 stars on Yelp.  I think that's just right for their new location as well.  A bit pricey, but their food and their staff have always been top notch when I've been there.  And I love what they've done with the new space.  Whatever mistakes were made when they opened will hopefully guide them to continue improving towards a long successful tenure on Portland Street.

mqXM-AdMvSKPcDrO9bBI-Q.text: Have been a long time fan of FEZ. Have never had a bad experience and always enjoy the food, drink, and staff. The hummus was delicious and at happy hour prices. Yeah!

NoA-9X7sYMsacTSKt9nLJw.text: Stop in to get a quick snack before getting hair done ! Awesome place ! Sat at bar had a snack and cocktail it was amazing ! Great service at bar !

55Ac6-xb_-RsNdg9bfJ1RQ.text: Sometimes a place earns a 5 just because of the food, or even just the food you ordered that time. This was that. I stopped into this sheik, modern, diner style restaurant and bar, and was pleasantly amazed by what I ate.   I had the FEZ lettuce wraps appetizer which were chicken with dried pears, dates, dried cherries & almonds with romaine lettuce shells. So good!  Then for the meal I had the FEZ Lemon & Pomegranate grilled plate with blackened salmon...wow! It had grilled veggies and pistachio rice.  Every bite of this meal was heaven.  (And it's a great song by Steely Dan)
