Photo of FEZ - Phoenix, AZ, United States. FEZ lettuce wraps

-o_5iBZjT5_7L7XH3fGzuA.text: Came here with my husband for brunch one evening before heading into work. Their pancakes were AMAZING, they were so huge and fluffy!  And i forgot what type of breakfest burrito I got, but it was so good and tasty. The service was great. Food was great. Everything was great lol

qIkBojzM9AFpfzlmtnF_Og.text: The food is good, that isn't the problem. It's just overpriced.  For one person, (no alcohol) at happy hour prices it came out to $30 a person.  Its very trendy so I understand that it likely has some overhead it has too meet.  but for it is I think it's overrated.  It's worth a bite.

iZlehKAtOSMNJA1szxMpcQ.text: I was absolutely disgusted/disappointed with this establishment. I went for a birthday dinner and ordered the All American Burger and got more than I wanted! Halfway through my meal I noticed a piece of metal in my meal. After bringing this to the attention of our server Martin he informed the manager Tim. Tim came over and tried to make light of the situation by making jokes, however, it made me feel uncomfortable as it was a laugh to be had at my expense. We felt as though he was mocking the fact that a piece of metal was in my meal, but this could have turned out to be a lot more serious had I actually bit into it. There was no answer on where it came from and how it found its place on my plate. I am writing this review in hopes that this establishment takes this seriously and it does not happen to someone else.   I will post a pic....

photos.caption: Photo of FEZ - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Metal wire found in meal

cKofMnGlANKajgAH8GL3dg.text: Met up with a friend last night with our dogs, so we sat on their dog-friendly patio. Brandon was very helpful in bringing the pups some water. I have been here several times and the food and drinks are always delicious.

h2u2y_vfUqS-ka9vL6Vqyw.text: I've eaten here before with good results but tonight the kitchen was a train wreck. Dirty table, dirty appetizer plate, calamari was soft, dripping with grease and made us kind of nauseous after we ate about half of it. (In hindsight should have sent it back but we were really hungry) Left it and went on to entrees, mushy veggie curry and a gyro kisra that was basically dry bread topped with mounds of dry spinach and some gyro meat. Both were abandoned mostly untouched. I looked at my companion trying hard to politely eat her entree and said "Forget it, let's just get out of here".  She responded with no argument and a look of relief. Left $70++ lighter, pissed and without eating dinner.

YwZVJzrpWdELjXWpOXczYw.text: Really nice place to have a lunch on a hot summer day. Our waitress was amazing. She was very concerned that we were satisfied with our food. Our food was cooked to perfection. Even on a busy lunch rush we were made to feel as if we were the most important people there. Will be returning again and again.

photos.caption: Photo of FEZ - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Gummy water just because.

qCI0cB-25H0mlYOKQ_4kFA.text: This was my first time here and I my food was for take out but here we go.   The ambiance was cool, trendy, definitely has the potential to become very loud. I was there when they opened so it was pretty empty.   I ordered a burger and fries along with a salad. I never ended up eating the salad as I forgot it in the car and in AZ that is a ticket to nastyville real quick.   The fries were great, crunchy, thin, but a little salty and the burger was fresh, the meat was nice but it would have been nice if there was a little more seasoning. Bun was fresh and soft (like I like em) and the veggies were crisp, thanks FEZ.  I will definitely go and dine in here next time.

photos.caption: Photo of FEZ - Phoenix, AZ, United States

7cwXJOLlS1mVZD24wS07LA.text: FOOD: Had a bomb ass rib eye here that came with fried pieces of onion, asparagus, and like a gallon of mashed potatoes on the side. For 30 bucks the rib eye had perfect marbling and a good balance of meat to fat ratio. Only reason I don't have a photo is because I was drunk and smashed my phone on the ground because I'm stupid and I had to get a new phone and never backed up my photos.   SERVICE: The service was IMPECCABLE. I tipped FAT.  VENUE: Just a couple blocks north of downtown, this is a hidden gem in Phoenix. Place was dimly lit and had lots of seating. Parking is easy because God knows no one lives in Arizona. The state is like a ghost town compared to LA.

iN27BiZAWALRQVom9N_apA.text: I've been coming here for the last 5 years. It's probably about time to leave a review.   The staff is all very friendly, great open atmosphere, customer service is very attentive - even when they're very busy. Music has decent different types playing, though a decent amount of pop as well for the broad majority.   Food is very tasty, with a wide variety of options. Menu is changed up every so often. Though, I rarely deviate from a variation of the Fez Burger.   Highly recommend.   PS - Don't be scared of the bar if you're going alone. They're very awesome there too.

4vXaQhQ3qrPtVs9Cd728pA.text: I was so happy to find these guys right across the street from my hotel. Great menu with many healthy options.  Kira took care of my -not so healthy-nacho dinner ($8 @ happy hour). It was enough for at least two people.    Luke arrived w a smile to assist with my Spa-tini; an amazing, herbal, cucumber & lemon libation.  He kept me from feeling so 'table for one' with engaged conversation.    I will be back at the same hotel, often.  These guys are my new hotel restaurant.    See them 4-6, for daily Happy Hour savings.

9mVwpRc_MBYklrbp-BIEag.text: Very relaxed atmosphere for a mid day brunch outing. The service was friendly and there was a fairly wide menu list of options to choose from. The protein punch which consisted of mostly assorted meats on a bed of spinach was plentiful and delicious. Would definitely recommend to those looking for a casual brunch experience.

UWksl2s4RaTm2vJ6YF9pfw.text: I love everything about this little eatery. I've been visiting Fez before it moved from 7th St to here. Sure the menu's changed a lot, but so has everything else, right?   First thing first, there are booths and tables. Wide bodies like me will do well with the tables and very sturdy chairs. Even the patio chairs feel reliable and "safe" for bigger butts (like mine).   I started with a nonalcoholic drink called Morroccan something and it was superb.  Followed this up with a bowl of FEZ Feta Fries and rolled my eyes after each forkful. These are sooo good! My friend ordered the fries with bacon bits and a Thousand Island-like topping but it didn't taste good to me. Too salty IMO.   No one ordered entrees, just appetizers and drinks and a good time was had by all!  PS- shout out to Allison our server for being awesome!

photos.caption: Photo of FEZ - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Water, Morroccan drink, water
Photo of FEZ - Phoenix, AZ, United States. FEZ Feta Fries
Photo of FEZ - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Morroccan drink with basil, lemon. Tasty!

-lmrXs8__SMijPIp0Xcikg.text: I just want to start off by saying that FEZ IS THE REASON WHY I AM AND WILL ALWAYS BE OBSESSED WITH SWEET POTATO FRIES AND FRIED CALAMARI. And it's really the only place that serves these two dishes in the most mouth-watering way. No other restaurant can compare!  I first came here (the old location) in 2012 for a girl's day and ever since, it has been our tradition to come here for our meetups! The new location is GORGEOUS and has such a vibe. I love it.  Everyone that works here is the nicest person ever and their bartenders make a helluva drink. I am normally good off of one lol.   Food is always superb! Their cheeseburgers are probably my favorite. They turn something so simple into a unique cuisine that is refreshing to the palate. My stomach is growling just from writing about it!

photos.caption: Photo of FEZ - Phoenix, AZ, United States

a3emYHUpN4En5DK5B6P5uA.text: The FEZ Baja Tacos and Mascarpone Cheesecake were both absolutely delicious!  The FEZ Baja Tacos are three corn tacos with grilled chicken, beef, or shrimp, with pomegranate sauce, feta, onions, tomatoes, cilantro, and salsa. I chose them with grilled chicken. The pomegranate sauce with the feta cheese went incredibly well together! This dish was around $10.  The Mascarpone Cheesecake (has a hazelnut chocolate layer) was around $9 and tasted like heaven.  Service was fantastic, my server was Austin. And the place was beautiful - retro and yet modern simultaneously.

photos.caption: Photo of FEZ - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Baja Tacos.
Photo of FEZ - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Mascarpone Cheesecake, has a layer of hazelnut chocolate - was divine!

ve0j5EEvWl_R-qjwoo6Q8A.text: Love this not so little gem! Stopped in for lunch and enjoyed their Bleu Cobb Salad. One of the freshest full of flavor salads I have had in a long time. Sat up at the bar (had to partake in some AM bubbles) and the service was definitely a five star experience. Dying to check it out as far as night life because it definitely has that vibe so I'll let you know

mQ1aFJSwyYWqX0e9iQy3NA.text: I really like the food at this spot! The casa blanca sandwiches is one of my favorites. Got a great variety of unique menu options. Friendly service.

photos.caption: Photo of FEZ - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Great chicken dish

SVWWnDIsvc5NuHUmSojSIw.text: If your looking for a good brunch spot I truly recommend FEZ, the prices are super affordable and the service is amazing.  I had a  American Breakfast with a big boy mimosa (with fresh OJ & w/ shot of orange vodka)

photos.caption: Photo of FEZ - Phoenix, AZ, United States. American Breakfast with a big boy mimosa (with fresh OJ &amp; w/ shot of orange vodka)

jZIVkQfH1mClLzVGsuczow.text: This place holds a special place in my heart! My boyfriend and I had our 1st date here(old location) 5 1/2 years ago!! Since then we have been at least 30 times! The employees are amazing and always so friendly, even when busy! The food is always fresh and the drinks are GREAT!! We are always planning our next outing as soon as we leave!  Our favorites from the menu are: -Pesto Caesar Salad with Chicken  -Lettuce Wraps -Fez Burger  -Sweet potato Fries

EeZSrQ3GVRiU00wTVyzALw.text: Stopped by here for brunch this morning with hubby. I have eaten here several times in the past at lunchtime but never for brunch and I'm wondering what took me so long! We were seated right away as we got there right when they opened. They have a nice selection of brunch drinks - both alcoholic and non-alcoholic. Hubby and I both opted for a Bloody Mary. I got the Cucumber Mary and he opted for the Kirk's Green Mary. Although we both thought each other's were good, we both preferred the ones we had ordered. Although I have to admit I did like the hint of sweetness right after the bit of spice in his! I ordered the Breakfast Pasta and I was in total heaven. The eggs were creamed throughout and there was the perfect amount of bacon and sausage that every bite was a little different. And the peppers they added were the icing on the cake. Will definitely go back and order that again! Hubby opted for the Greek Eggs Benedict. His was really good as well however he would have preferred the eggs poached rather than scrambled like it came out. We really enjoyed our meal and I will have to bring hubby back for lunch or dinner one day soon!

photos.caption: Photo of FEZ - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cucumber Mary and Kirk&#39;s Green Mary
Photo of FEZ - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Greek Eggs Benedict
Photo of FEZ - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Breakfast Pasta

8VBxVy2mB4JzaPL_ydzIDA.text: There is absolutely no better brunch in Phoenix than the Fez.  The hotcake (ridiculously moist, sweet and crazy large) and a side of sausage are my staples.  I literally dream about this breakfast.  The sausage is  zesty, fresh and also large serving (no need to get more than one).  Add that with a Mimosa bucket for $15 and you have the makings of perfection.  The patio is nice and big, with plenty of outdoor seating.  The staff are always quite friendly, attentive and provide great service.  A wonderful place to enjoy a Sunday morning.  Cheers

fKwhNrVM6iDZMpvNyXwxfg.text: This place is super cute, the food is great, and have a neat bar area. It is very affordable considering the amount of food you get. The service is consistently good as well. Definitely worth checking out !

Sw1reZAvgUXbkPglUzJR-g.text: Came in for lunch last month as my friend was craving macaroni and cheese. She ordered it with chicken and it was so good! I actually want to go back and order it for myself! I had the regular caesar salad with shrimp which was delicious. The only thing that was not the greatest was the service.

_r8M4CKXgZo90orf1oALNw.text: My partner and I have been frequenting FEZ for several years now.  It's one of our mainstay brunch locations.  Weekdays they don't open until 11 so don't make that mistake.  But on weekends - it's reliable, consistent good service, fresh and tasty food that has never disappointed.  It's an imaginative menu that puts a fun twist on most standard faire.  The location is awesome as it's near several good walking areas (if weather permits!).  Note parking is available in the ramp next door, rather than fight with the few spots on a heavy traffic street.

kdkarUN4zEU3Suryq1u8oA.text: I came here with friends that recommended it. I still to this day regret not buying the Caesar salad. I instead ordered the sausage and sweet potatoes. It literally was just 3 or 4 sausage links and crispy sweet potato fries. I could have made the same thing at home, nothing special. Just tasted like a late night out after going to a bar.   If I ever end up coming back, I'll try something else. My friends liked their plate they ordered.

photos.caption: Photo of FEZ - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sausage and sweet potatoes

ONYYNsFiCdhHsGwAwl_XWw.text: I wasn't happy with an experience but the owner reached out and I can tell they care. I give that 5 stars.

Vl-YMBxlV9Jr-u8ov0lxvw.text: This is such a cute place in downtown. Fun place to hang out and a great menu with something for everyone! Lots of healthy options as well! We did the guacamole and chips for appetizer but ate too quickly to snap a photo lol. Only issue was they charged me for extra salsa lol! Tell people if you're charging them :p The salad I had was delicious and my husband had the protein plate which he really enjoyed. The portions are huge so he had enough from both of us for his dinner. The spot is nice with a large outdoor patio and ample bar seating. They appear to take reservations for the booths so if you want a booth call ahead and reserve it :) We enjoyed the ambiance and will for sure be back. Parking situation is a parking garage where it's free for two hours. Good staff and everyone was pleasant to us while we were there. Cool spot to hang out after work for sure. They have daily drink specials as well.

photos.caption: Photo of FEZ - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Place
Photo of FEZ - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bar
Photo of FEZ - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Protein plate

IIyx5DrM5xi9FjfCtaQSJw.text: I've been to FEZ a total of 3 times in the last 2 years. The first time, I wasn't very impressed, but the other 2 times (recently), I enjoyed my time  and will definitely be back.  Happy hour here after work was pretty fun. I had the FEZ nachos w/ chicken and the chick strips ala FEZ (aka chicken fingers/strips). The nachos were a HUGE serving size and super yummy. The chicken strips were pretty good and came with a unique dipping sauce (I forgot what it's called). Another time, our group had the grilled chicken pita and the chicken phyllo packets. The pita was alright. But man... the phyllo packets were delicious. It's crispy (but light) on the outside, juicy and soft on the inside. It came with another mysterious dipping sauce that complemented them very well.  Decor is modern and there are seats indoors and out in the patio. Parking is easy - there's a garage shared with the church, nearby businesses & apartment residents. Customer service has been on point each time. Can't wait to come back!

yd1Psm9Pye4cA9_Bi-5rHQ.text: Horrible food, horrible service. This place used to be soooo good. The calamari used to be the best around. Now it's bland and they don't even serve the tentacles anymore. Which means it's just frozen store bought. Waitress forgot to put in my order so I had to wait 35 minutes for my food while everyone else at the table was already done eating. I had to wait that long because I sat there for 10 minutes and then had to track her down to ask about my food. She never even came back to check or ask where my food was. When my food came out, My egg white omelette was absolutely DRENCHED in oil. I even showed the waitress. And the toasts that came with it were hard as a rock like they were sitting out all night.   This used to be one of my favorite spots. Now that the quality has slowed down with the food and the service, I will not be returning. There's too many other good restaurants around to go to. RIP Fez : (

HuvOe8DDIyuvZcEG4rWONg.text: Dirty location!!! I was in the front waiting for food delivery and was bit by something several times!!! Staff is rude and stated I must have had the bites before coming in! I refuse to eat at a place that doesn't keep a clean restaurant.

GbqEuUDiXYFvb44YFE9dNg.text: We went to Fez because it was convenient. We were very happy we did!  The food was very good the service was excellent and the prices were very reasonable. We had the phyllo chicken packets, the cheesy cauliflower dip and the feta fries. Very tasty! We will definitely visit again if we are in the area.

QUUlo6Z6ufNsFMQ8pNiFug.text: Kind of a hipster place decor, if you want a booth and you are only 2 people you much call and reserve, otherwise you will have a table so small you cannot put your purse on it and 2 chairs again no room to put your purse.  Went with a girlfriend and split a burger, they charged us the $2 for an extra plate.  Had a cup of soup too salty on the tomato lentil . Ordered a large basket of fries part salt and pepper and part garlic and rosemary, they were good, at first couldn't taste the garlic, but it showed up later after leaving the restaurant. There is a parking garage right next to the place so thats not an issue. Service was pleasant, place was clean and the restrooms have two stalls. Pricey though two people splitting a burger, large fries and 2 cups of soup and water over $31 It was an experience that I won't have again.

Oz6exTRUHXyP9Rwn7I55fQ.text: Delicious! The burger and fries were great, and they had a good beer selection.  It was a little loud, I want able to easily hear my friends, but that's to be expected at 11pm on a Friday.   The prices seemed fair.

79HlcmULVoME7BbKJRQamA.text: I heard a lot of great things about this restaurant and was excited to try it but left disappointed. Ordered the lamb sliders which was tasteless. The beef street tacos were also bland. The staff was friendly but the food we ordered was overpriced for what it was.

Lx8uIdbnAW3yWTGN0lF1DQ.text: Blown away. My wife and I had a date night at FEZ and there was not one disappointment. Food was great and service was outstanding!

LrhgdCeJBgOog9c0eVhXxw.text: My wife and I had dinner there this evening with hopes for a Mediterranean meal. Two hours later she is feeling ill and I'm throwing up.   The first food order was Baba Ghanoush. One bite and back it went. It tasted awful and not even close to the real thing. It was the texture of stirred canned dog food and brown. I've never seen brown eggplants!  So I ordered lamb sliders. The lamb was ground, dry and lacked any lamb flavor. Lots of salt though. My wife decided on nachos, thinking that had to be safe. She asked for the beef topping. The chips were just weird. No corn flavor at all. The cheese was whipped Velveta. The beef was ground and tasted two days old. Taco Bell nachos are much better. We did not finish either.   My regret is I was not there two hours later to return the meal.   Never again!!!!!  PS The service was very good with a very polite waiter.  Not his fault.

1RPZWO9sMSsEW2pfRnCFMQ.text: Staying at foundre and had avoided this place from reviews. However, we were pleasantly surprised.  We got food today and we were greeted upon arrival by three separate people.  Food was delicious.  Got blue cheese salad, my husband got American burger and garlic rosemary fries. All were fresh and delicious.  Great location. Cute atmosphere. Will return upon our return to Phoenix.

2tiOKI1oc9lf8sQ5zXGCRg.text: So much variety that it's always a challenge to pick one dish..everything tastes so good. With the parking garage right next door, it's my go-to place for lunch in downtown area without having to worry about finding a parking spot. Can get noisy for family with kids sometime if you're inside and the table next to you is loud. All in all, great food & ambience.

AYrpH-k62gyETRDPFCAO2w.text: I love this place! Great food, great ambiance, great staff. They have a great variety of drinks and the food is delicious. Definitely recommend!

QvKjJZ1-KsMMT1iRQ_grYQ.text: Some of the best burger you will ever have! The meat is thick and soft. I love that they are shaped like a rectangle and me and my husband sometimes share one because they are very filling. The sweet potato fries are addicting they have sugar sprinkled on them and the sauce that comes with it complements it to perfection. The worst part is that when you are full you still have to keep eating because they are so good. The service is always great. The Rosemary fries are also very tasty.

DoIU2A_fM7SmIba2F6Ye3w.text: Fez is an amazing place with a great staff and a big variety of hreat drinks  Nick is an amazing bartender that truly knows how to make a great cocktail and always goes the extra mile to make each visit unique and special. 5 stars plus for this place. Kirk the GM makes a great chocolate martini which is a must have when visiting Fez

IqEl94vEecebW5JCAlRznw.text: New to the downtown Phoenix area from out of state. FEZ is one of our great finds in the neighborhood. We have had a great experience both times that we were there, that will lead us to more returns in the future. Our 1st visit we had NORA as our server, she was warm/welcoming and knowledgeable....she validated our selections and made suggestions that resulted in an up-sell to our order. We came back a week later based off of the positive experience with NORA (we specifically asked for her as our server, but she had the day off)...CALEB was our second experience dining at FEZ...Equally as welcoming and knowledgeable. We appreciated his suggestions to our order and his friendly nature. CALEB went beyond just "waiting" on our table-He took the time to engage with us as people and not just "paying customers". I'm going on and on about the service, but haven't mentioned the food.....Margarita's in many flavors (I had Apricot), Lamb sliders (had those both times I was there), Baja Tacos...all good....I usually stick with what I know/like, but looking forward to trying other things on the menu!! We will be back and back many times!!

MrbflVuWXvShgQbXMAZJNA.text: Attending a nearby event and went there for lunch. Wait staff (male) was condescending when I mispronounced a word on the menu. After we got our food he ignored us and we had to flag down a different waiter to get our check. The male then said he would bring our check and didn't for another 5-10 min. Again another waiter ended up taking our payment. We were late getting back from lunch to our event.   However, the food was delicious just wish the service was the as good.

ajt56HZb4174NN3Pp7gPoA.text: FEZ was a cute place and modern. It reminded me a lot of ALOFT decor in comparison to the W. I think it is a modern restaurant done on a budget. That isn't to knock on it, but just calling it how I see it.   The staff is great and the restaurant as a whole seems very gay friendly (coming from a gay man). We dined on a Wednesday night I believe it was and the night before was very "lively" from what my co-worker said (assuming more straight and busy). The night we went there was definitely more of a gay crowd, and I liked it! The area it is in is a little further from downtown and looks a little less lite and rough in a sense.   Apps:  (1) lamb sliders - these were AMAZING! It wasn't my idea to order these, but they were definitely a must get! (2) nazare' calamari - Calamari was average as most calamari - it was good. The aioli was definitely done right!    Entree: (1) go green pasta - this was recommended by the waiter and definitely DELICIOUS! The portions are huge, so of course I couldn't finish it, but I couldn't stop eating it either! I had it with chicken and the spring vegetables were plenty! From asparagus to Zucchini all of it was delicious, and I didn't even realize I liked Zucchini!   Drink:  (1) I had a few beers on tap! Nothing special!! I am sure everything is great though!

nEV1GeuepATYc7g6y55m4Q.text: Loved the location, and the restaurant is super cute. We had the cauliflower dip which was delicious. The portion was generous and everyone at our table loved it. I had the pecan crusted salmon. The dish was good, the salmon was a little dry, but had a good taste. We had a great waiter. Overall it was a great experience.

gPeuwKIx8x-Li-1dn-BN5w.text: Great Happy Hour!  For dinner, the golden curry with blackened chicken is fantastic!   So much fun here!  Everyone is fun and happy!

ECWdlRQ1NdzJmu6PeME5Tg.text: Location is perfect!  The restaurant is beautiful.  Music is great!  The food is decent.  The service was horrible.   I walked in, waited a few minutes for someone to give us a table, then someone finally came and sat us down. He have me quite a smart alec response to a question. That's cool.   Our server took our order. She forgot to bring me my drink. She didn't bring my sister a plate. My sister ate off a napkin. How classy.   The food- meh. My rosemary chicken sandwich needed salt and the chicken was dry. The fries were TOOOOOO salty. Oh, and my sister found a live bug crawling on her pomegranate Margarita. I have a really bad tummy ache from the food last night, too. Oh yay!  We went on a Thursday at 10pm and should of got great service since we were basically the only ones there. I can only imagine what FEZ is like on a busy day. Oh well!

0DOxQQnK20-94QRw7iiMJA.text: Sit at the bar, have Kirk order you either a G spot or a pear martini along with feta fries with bacon and a gyro bowl and you will not regret this.

photos.caption: Photo of FEZ - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Best pear martini in town!

0oOQlzW3VSWelKBJcYlzuw.text: We went "go green pasta" and grillete salmon (the only fish option, But a super good one). Everything was super tasty! Prices are ok, not the cheapest but affordable, and worth it! The place is very nice, comfy bar area inside. The patio is my kind of place to eat, get some drinks and talk. Don't get to close to the borders bc you get some homeless asking for dollars, not cool if you are trying to enjoy ur meal... The service is good! Hope you get a good time here if you decide to come!

TGc6BcQk5xKilOaDLOaNQQ.text: I think the restaurant has improved since it has moved downtown to the new location.  It is an awesome addition to the area.  I loved the arroz con pollo.  The mascarpone cheesecake is delicious.  I hope this place continues to thrive.

H5a6AUWj_d_4gUoZQdhF8A.text: Bring back the Monday night specials . Baja burger and arroz con pollo are no longer on special . My margarita tasted watered down and I found a dehydrated apricot swimming around in it . The wedge salad is also no longer on the menu and they substituted the champagne dressing with a vinaigrette , not tasty at all. Truly disappointed about Mondays .

gtQE7h8o_IulSKbshelSDQ.text: One of my absolute all time favorite places to eat. Gyro pizza and the tangier burger are my favorites. Recommend the weekend breakfasts they serve as well. Quite tasty.

70-NziWOwl1qaeo-bUL_pg.text: Just had the Rosemary Chicken sandwich and side salad and it was really really good.  It was really flavorful and juicy and well topped.  The salad was really nice. I like that it comes standard instead of fries.   Perfect lunch.

VTBddonnL8zB4M_mrM4L0w.text: Really crowded but our food came fast and service was nice. Had the Rosemary chicken sandwich and it was great. Will be back

0MTj1rEXAPRs89jORWFNtw.text: I ate lunch with my family and I have to say that is one of the best restaurant I have ever ate at. I had the caesar pistachio salad that was the BEST salad I have ever had I totally recommend it

9RsWbwqr0N4oXtA6ZfI7zA.text: Great food and great atmosphere but the service is very slow and the server's messed up our order and delivered food from other tables to ours. Hope they can fix this problem I would love to go back. The califlowwer app was amazing.

1ZPPAfTk9vqqUYkiW59JTA.text: I love going to this restaurant before I head out to one of the Phoenix clubs. The staff is so fun and friendly. The restaurant is really elegant and the music in the background is perfect. The cinnamon fries, the Ciabattas, the drinks and the lettuce wraps are all my favs!

I1wZpJIY_eoSDRv-vQITiw.text: Aside from all the wonderful food we ate, (the pizza with pesto was my favorite) and the friendly, attentive service, the restaurant staff did something for me I will forever be thankful for. To make a long story short, I left my wallet in the bathroom at Fez on my road trip. Realizing this 400 miles later, I thought my money, credit cards and ID was kaput. The staff found my wallet and the manager priority mailed it to me on his day off the very next day!!! This was a truly amazing experience that I will never forget. Thank you so much.

NFIHc_zrC1SIkI7rA7JBpQ.text: I drive out from Anthem just to have their eggs benedict and I crave their bloody mary's!

gnzpyama8ABOCJ5UbJqcJQ.text: My review is a little different, since I haven't actually eaten at Fez before. I'm visually impaired and   wandered in accidentally while on the way to a coffee shop nearby, and an employee  was kind enough to escort me to this other  business. When I wandered in, I was told the name of the business, and when I ask for assistance, it was given without hesitation. This could've been on a busy night, and The employee may have had a lot on her plate, but took the time to help me out. This speaks very highly not only to the kind of person this employee is, but likely speaks to the caliber of her colleagues at Fez. one of their employees may have led me over to a competitive business, I will likely be stopping by in the near future. Ymay be impatient with a long wait on a busy night, or small errors in the delivery of service, I just wanted to express my appreciation for this act of kindness, and by extension for  Fez  and it's quality of customer service.

lMG0fIRQjxBKiKI8RS1ijw.text: I live in the neighborhood and fez is a now favorite spot, especially with good eats and drinks late till midnight. Not gonna lie, it's more of a "treat yo' self" spot with entrees averaging about $15 for some bomb ass food. They do have a reverse happy hour with house wines, wells, beers, and margaritas for $4 plus $2 off apps. My server was Brian. ASK FOR HIM! Seriously awesome vibe that completed our late night quest for a full belly and good feelings! Fez is chill and Brian is just even a little more chill. 6 out of 5 stars and a high five!

UdouaqVdhhmOK-Pn6GdWKQ.text: Lindsey, Kirk, and Tim are the coolest and best people in the industry! I will definitely be coming back next week for the Super Bowl shenanigans!

F7ytaRGx4r7nh7EDqRJYjQ.text: Fez was great before they moved to their new location after they moved they got new waiters who are stuck up, unfriendly and won't let you pick where u sit unless you have more than two people in your group.  BEWARE the location is terrible, watch your vehicle someone tried to break in mine in the parking garage! Also the drinks are terrible!

1UaTG_sRXJxHcqb8yghEyw.text: I've been to Fez a couple of times now and it never disappoints! Although the prices are a little high in my opinion, it's worth spending every once in a while. My go-to order is a Calamari appetizer (the sauce that comes with it is DELICIOUS), Arroz con Pollo, and a Feztini. Aside from the food and drinks, the location is awesome, with a nice view of a park area. I love this place and I'll definitely be back!

gAZSh5VXNaz1ZtqYz0SpHw.text: Only reason i didn't rate higher was because the service was a bit to be desired.  i know they were busy and just opened.  the place was packed and the ambiance and decor were fantastic!!  i haven't been to Fez in eons.  loved the food - lamb sliders and salerno bruschetta plate.  the 3 with the dates was yummy but the tomato bruschetta ones i didn't care for as much.  my girlfriend felt exactly the opposite so it's just a difference in taste.    the pomtini martini was FANTASTIC... with just the right amount of alcohol and taste in a chilled glass.  the 2nd one at our table was obviously made by someone else because it was no where near as good or chilled (a bit too sweet).  Our server, Kirk, forgot to bring the 2nd drink for my girlfriend as well.  However, the service overall was  wonderful.

46D492bzVGuMcFbJGrAaUA.text: I've been here about 3 times now and have only been helped once. I don't know why I keep coming back. I guess I just wanted to give them the benefit of the doubt and try their food up at the bar but the bartenders act as if I'm not even there. I have a feeling I was dressed too casually for the expectations of this place and that's why they keep ignoring me? I don't know. So, in my experience the service is lacking and I can't comment on the food because I  am not offered service when I sit at the bar.

YQ14kp4s0mJpLU3f1l39xg.text: A friend and I went during happy hour. I ordered a gyro bowl, side of pita bread, chicken strips and strawberry margarita.. The food was DELICIOUS and staff was GREAT!! Oh my I can't wait to go back to try every dish on there menu. Oh the margarita was made with fresh strawberries.:)

photos.caption: Photo of FEZ - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mmmmm good!!!! Gyro bowl, chicken strips and strawberry margarita

xfVwE_ARubarzMbQwJOj1Q.text: Went for a quick bite before a movie had the gyro bowl and strawberry salad. Both very good! Our server was great, we can't wait to go back!

MgEkSk1Srb86xgxYMcLziQ.text: Happy hour used to be the best in town. Bring back $4 margaritas! $12 for a burger and the fries not included? You might be special but not that special. Throw the fries in.

lqXvwTLmydxaf1qJ2oz5uA.text: Never went to the Central Avenue location, but really enjoyed the new neighborhood location.  Good drinks. Good specials, Good service. Good Food! Enjoyed the entire experience.

Nl_diVNVjsZH6mGGorc83w.text: Stopped here for brunch with my mom on a Sunday after church. We decided to try FEZ because they have gluten free options/substitutions, which was fabulous for me! We were able to parallel park right in front of the restaurant doors, but if you aren't so fortunate, there is a parking garage available! The hostess greeted us when we walked in and was incredibly friendly! we waited about 15 minutes or so for a table, and when we were seated, our waiter met us immediately and was incredibly accommodating. I ordered the FEZ Benedict with a substitution of gluten free toast. it. was. amazing. My mom got the "Best egg white omelet you'll ever have" and agreed that it lived up to the name. the prices were very reasonable, the atmosphere was great, and the service and food were incredible. great brunch stop!!

photos.caption: Photo of FEZ - Phoenix, AZ, United States. FEZ Benedict with a substitution of gluten free bread. delicious and great portions!!!

L3_2VGJhvR6cazZV0pZSQg.text: Great customer service. I enjoyed their silky mascarpone cheesecake and the chick strips ala FEZ.

079M1j3KopDCfkaZPK-nRQ.text: Absolutely recommend. Best place we ate at while we were in AZ! The drinks, the food, the service and the atmosphere were all awesome! Super good. I wish we had one in CO! Nora was our server I believe; she was great. Thanks!

QGYcgzM0c-Qm3MB0_yeE_A.text: Fez is usually a nice place to go especially on Sundays and i normally have a great experience which is why i send quiet a bit of guest over there. This past Sunday however, was absolutely the worst experience ever. I was greeted from a gentlemen asking the usual question how many people are with me (which i was alone at the time because i was having a friend meet me there) i then answered 2. I then asked if i could please sit outside, he answers sure. He goes out to the patio and comes back in with a terrible attitude stating "so its about to rain out there and if you decide to sit out there we are most likely not gonna have any seating inside". I look around and they have probably at the most 15 guest in the restaurant and about 6 outside... He then seats me outside with tension and i ask is there any specials today, he states "nope". He brings me back a glass of water and after almost 15 minutes of waiting there with no service i decide to get up to let him know that im going to leave after all but thank you. He then with an attitude and practically rolling his eyes says "okay great". I start walking out but then felt that i should let the manager know so that nobody else has to experience this kind of behavior or attitude. I ask him for the manager and he says "My name is joey, i am the manager". My jaw drops and i say "wow, well i just want to let you know that i feel you were absolutely rude and that i received terrible/No service". He gets upset and says with his finger, "how was i rude, how was i rude"! I then explained to joey that i am a concierge here in downtown phoenix and i will not be sending anyone there way because i would hate for anyone especially our guest to experience this sort of service. On a brighter note i walked over to Match Cuisine right in front and got the Best genuine service and i was taken care of very well. By the way it never rained outside..

h5e-9LDLPCPaOPkuR8tRiQ.text: Haven't been to Fez since they moved, but I absolutely loved their food at the previous location. This place was just as good and the location is perfect.

-WT1zEhGcvp34R5PuwBJpQ.text: Love. love, love the new location and the manager and staff are awesome!! The food is great ( I wish that they had just a bit more selection, but hey!) I have never been disappointed in the service or food. Give them a try...:) S and P fries are great!!

vhRq6WjVd7w10IuyHZ_XqQ.text: Great dinner and drinks at Fez tonight. I had a delicious  salad with berries and cashews. My wife had AMAZING curry that rivals what you might get in Thailand.  Friendly service that makes me wish I lived a bit closer.

pk9QipdmBEYuy1-mlrBJLw.text: Love, love, love this place! I have been a few times and never been disappointed. Everyone that works there is helpful, friendly, and happy, but two people I'd like to give shout outs to are Luke and Fabian. Fabian was our server most recently and we never had to ask for a thing. He brought extra water, ice, and anticipated everything we might want. On top of great service the food is delicious! I got the black bean burger, my friend got the Rosemary chicken sandwich, and both were yummy. I can't remember what her husband ate, but he was drinking the "G" Spot (on special) and in heaven. Awesome place right in the heart of downtown.

WiYcYUG0pHOInX_g2xuRXQ.text: Very Hip and trendy place!!! It has a great vibe and everyone is very nice...the food is very fresh and taste great!!! If you are passing through Phoenix "Fez" is a most stop spot!!!

photos.caption: Photo of FEZ - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Very glad we stopped here passing through Phoenix!!! Great atmosphere and the food is very fresh and taste great!!!

wpIvFZJXWkhRRYRHfjQeKg.text: Hip spot with great food. Love the little sofa lounge... So accommodating as you wait for a table ... Great for drinks & appetizers

photos.caption: Photo of FEZ - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Lounging while we wait for a table

FyKilzHNr2QvgiNJQ9akDw.text: The staff, the food, and the bar.. Simply amazing! I have no complaint, definitely on my top 3. Yesterday was my first time going and I have nothing else to say but that I will be back. The happy hour menu was also great!

lGfzE6T0iRqVpCpxQNCI1A.text: Great patio and wonderful service. I had a lunch meeting here  and was presently surprised with how great everything was.   While I was waiting for the rest of my group to get there I saw some great looking plates pass by. The hummus and apps looked amazing. We didn't try one this time but will be back for sure to test them out.   At this visit I had their pear and goat cheese salad with chicken. It was very tasty a little bit to much dressing for my taste I will make sure to get it on the side next time. But the pears were very flavorful and the dried cherries are just the right amount of sweet with the tang of goat cheese the dressing really ties it all together. I would go back for this again.   The other people I was with had the fez platter which looked amazing, chicken ad rice along with a bunch of goodies. And Cesar salad,  it comes with pistachio in it what a great idea. A little crunch and salt in the salad.   I will be returning here for sure it was great, the only problem I see is that their patio has a lot of sun light and in the summer it will get very how without shade and some misters.

jm5WSDSfCWNAm_JO3fwO5g.text: We have been here a few times and liked it. I have celiac, which really is a bummer for eating out. I often end up ordering salads or steaks when eating out since they're more likely to be safe. Fez does actually have gluten free bread for burgers and sandwiches, but it's not super. It was quite hard, and I ended up finishing my burger with a fork and knife rather than mess with the bread. Still, food was good, service was good. Their drinks are very creative and tasty.

DH26rcGM-Kx1GByZ-L50Nw.text: Great bartender,  awesome service and the food was wonderful.   A bit expensive but worth it.

-D-L2x2J7fHsrQNsEg2uWw.text: My first visit there. It will NOT be my last the manager, Tim, runs a brilliant, and sharp crew. Deanna created drinks that mesmorised me! I had the "Mac n Cheese dish which was rich, flavourful, and filling. The creme brulee could have been a tad larger serving, however was quite satisfying. This place merits 10 stars. I say this without hesitation. Tim, Deanna, Joey, you made my visit there a royal blast. As we'd say back in my U.K: :BANG ON! JOLLY GOOD SHOW! My heart sings!

sLeWdDAekn4ONxW9g2aHWA.text: My Sandwich was amazing the Rosemary fries were over salted but other than that pretty nice experience. Environment here is divine. & A nice location .

8BJkcOZJPvhfHDXdwtMEKA.text: We had such a lovely time at the old FEZ location, so on a return trip to Phoenix, we knew we'd have to visit again.  We came for brunch, and everything was great.  I had two mimosas, and felt pretty grand about my life. We ate on the patio because we had our dogs with us.  We ordered them some eggs and the waiter, very enthusiastic about dogs, said he'd add a side of chicken in there.  What we didn't consider, but perhaps should have because we understood FEZ's portions, is that the plates of egg and chicken that he brought out for our dogs was enough to feed an adult human, and our dogs weigh 12 and 22 pounds.  (And yes, he brought out TWO plates of food for them.)  We let the dogs indulge, but they couldn't handle their own gluttony, and were sick the rest of the weekend.  Really we know that this is our fault for not taking the portions away sooner, or specifying size better to the waiter.  But as someone who said he was a small dog owner himself, I still can't quite understand what he was thinking.  Surely he doesn't feed his own dogs that much!! So, FEZ is solidly four stars.  The lack of sleep that resulted in endless trips outside that night makes me hindsight it to 3.

fVIj3fxgAo9PO_Wv_VNBjw.text: Fez was recommended by a seasoned foodie, and it definitely belongs on the list of the Valley's go-to spots. We enjoyed the sour lemon and French martinis, very nicely done and generous pours, followed by a chicken pita sandwich and the duxelles burger. Both superior, starting with the quality of the ciabatta bun on the burger and the killer pita bread. Great burgers are a treat, and Fez gets them right. I failed to ask where they get their ground beef, but suspect it is an artisanal butcher nearby. Regardless, this burger smells and tastes like prime steak ground in the kitchen to order, and that was just the beginning. The menu has many more things to try, demanding a return trip. The value make Fez a no-brainer for your list of regular spots.

sguMtGHPxIwMpow4IbCmqQ.text: My sister first told me about FEZ. I then tried it out for myself. The server came and greeted us and we were seated right after, then we ordered. I first ordered the pita and humus as a entree. The humus was great, the pita was also great and still hot when it came out of the kitchen. I then ordered the hamburger with fries.  It did take a little longer than I expected to come out of the kitchen. I was not amazed but it still was pretty tasty. My sister ordered the nachos with chicken witch I tasted. The cheese was still hot and melted and the chicken cooked perfectly. Over all the food was good. The server then found out it was my sisters birthday and brought out a dessert. Which I thought was very kind of the staff and also they did not charge us for the dessert. The dessert was a nut brownie with ice cream I thought it was very delicious. I would totally recommend FEZ. Its kid friendly and has delicious food.

VBy_gxvrSuCuk3abHWhZCg.text: The food was really good.  I had the basil chicken sandwich.  The service was good and very friendly.    I will definitely be back.

FHaF1O5_IIea6UU3vZaAsQ.text: We have been here a couple of times and the food is great. As good as the food is the service is even better. Very eclectic and fun.

FTKOjEzqIalmjmvIIJhVgg.text: I feel like this place requires a pros and cons list, so here goes:  Pros: the vibe is great. It morphs from restaurant to club at about 8, and it would be a fun place to get a drink. The sweet potato fries are the bomb, and the margarita I had was pretty good. Location is great too. Prices are also pretty good.  Cons: it's one of those places that makes you think the art of customer service is officially dead. When my friend and I arrived, there were several open tables. The host acted like it was a HUGE burden to seat us (despite it being, ya know, his job). He wanted to seat us at a bar table even though several booths were open. He said no outside seating was available when there was definitely an open table that we walked past on our way in. We asked for a booth because the bar tables were too tall for me to sit comfortably in the dress I was wearing. This whole interaction put a sour taste in my mouth from the get go. Not a good first impression. My main dish, the Go Green Pasta, was mediocre. Too much sauce and made me feel a little sick later.   I probably won't go back.

faGMCuJiyHDbgZ7KyaV_gg.text: The food is always amazing and the fries are on point. I live in another state and every time I visit, I make my way to FEZ. I've had positive experiences for four years straight. The burgers are amazing. Love the happy hour drinks.

R6dDEP90q_CxCWQZ5qsSLA.text: One of thee best happy hours around ... period!!!  The margaritas and mojitos are heavenly ... so are the lamb sliders and fez fries. I've been to Fez for happy hour more times than I can count. I've only been for brunch once but plan to go back really soon with my Meetup group ... hopefully   I believed there's happy hour 7 days a week, or at least daily drink specials that's about $4 and $5 bucks. I've never had an issue wth parking outside directly outside it in the parking lot and the patio area is dog friendly.

xJXGV49wW0hP__D9Hfhh1A.text: It was my first time here. It wasn't so bad. I can't speak on the food but the drinks were good!   The bartender was friendly and sweet. The atmosphere reminder me a lot of the West Village in NYC.    Next visit, I'll try the food!!!

photos.caption: Photo of FEZ - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Happy hour round two!

PQOU77OVZyfHXnfGLeKsrA.text: This was my first time eating here with friends who'd been here before. They warned me ahead of time that the food was good but the service was mediocre at best. Well they were on point about service.  It was probably close to the slowest service I've experienced in awhile. It wasn't even crowded which was kinda odd. You would have thought the service would have been better.  We ordered a cheese board. It was to include nuts and prosciutto. The nuts ended up being shaved almonds ( as my friend said something you would put on a salad) and rolled ham. I know what the difference is. We sent it back and the waiter said we're about to take it off the menu anyway. Could he have told us before we ordered it? So we made it simple for them and ordered chips, salsa and guacamole which again took forever to get to us. At this point we're all starving. I ordered a simple cheese burger. It honestly had no real flavor. They say brunch is a better time to come not that the service is any better but the food is better. I want to give Fez one more chance hopefully my next experience will be a better one.

photos.caption: Photo of FEZ - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cheese burger. Not much flavor. I was disappointed.

S2fDHAB_Lzp2Kr-klIDw5w.text: I would totally give this place 5 stars BUT the service was absolutely HORRIBLE Kira our server was beyond passive aggressive and made my friend and I feel incredibly uncomfortable, honestly my Great Pyrenees would give better service than this girl. At first I thought okay maybe she's just having a bad day but no she was nice and attentive to all her tables except for ours. She didn't bring us waters when we got there (mind you it's summer time in the desert) she only came to check up on us twice out of our entire time there. Just a nasty server, but the food was AMAZING shout out to the cooks wish I could tip them instead of Kira.

1qTnTyOlmmXs5U7NYqhHeA.text: FEZ has been my go-to in downtown Phoenix ever since they offered delectable margaritas (in so many flavors! With creative, fun garnish!) at prices unheard of since Paz closed down.   Happy hour has since changed into daily specials and discounted appetizers. My favorite is the feta fries, especially if you ask for the mint yogurt sauce for dipping. And as for the margaritas, every flavor is spot on.   The menu is Mediterranean inspired with some fresh twists on other regional foods, such as the coconut curry--add blackened chicken if you eat meat. Veggies make a strong appearance in many of the dishes, so there is reason to justify it is health food.   If you have a dog in tow, this is the perfect place to take a seat on the patio with your pup. The nearby Hance Park ensures several sightings of fellow furry friends so your dog will be just as entertained as you are.   Free parking is available to customers of FEZ, Fair Trade, and surrounding businesses in the adjacent garage. The atmosphere is fairly vibrant and trendy, making it more date friendly than for families.

79ZEDK15Azd6876GFhZ3Xg.text: The food was outstanding.  Service was a bit slow, but everyone was kind and upbeat.  Overall a pretty good experience.

hGgYt7ODLydPwSpQHoSu3Q.text: Delightful place. I ordered a gyro and salad comes with it. The gyro meat was very tasty, and the salad unusual and flavorful. I couldn't pass up dessert, a brownie with ice cream. Prices were reasonable, service was friendly and decor urban.

nfnnc2fbm9TfeZ_2Byv7nQ.text: Fez has delicious and interesting food, gracious servers, and a relaxed ambiance.  We love eating indoors or on their spacious patio. We have meetings there or meet friends, and it's always a great experience. Last night, I had the soft tacos, beef version, and they were the best tacos I have ever eaten.  Alongside the delectable Apricosmo, my favorite cocktail in the Universe-- well, just when you think Fez can't delight your tastebuds any more, they bring out an even more delicious menu item.  Have friends meet you, and park in the nearby parking building, free.

Vcrwrhc9CnkqqZOc6zrATg.text: great spot to enjoy libations and the food is great with big servings so be hungry! I had a great salad and everything is fresh..

PW1kpy93Lqu2KApVwj360A.text: This is a review for my gluten free experience.   I always look at a restaurant's menu beforehand, so I know my options. FEZ offers a gluten free bun for all of their burgers, but the menu does not specify which burger toppings/sauces are gluten free. I asked my waiter if he could check the specific ingredients for the FEZ burger. I don't know if there was a miscommunication... but he started explaining how there was no way to know for sure. I didn't understand that answer. I mean... either the toppings and sauces are made by someone in the kitchen or it comes in a package with ingredients listed. The conversation ended with him agreeing to check the packaging.   Turns out, the FEZ burger is gluten free (with the exception of the fried onions). Their bun was SUPER dry and just not good. I know that's usually the story with gluten free buns, but I've definitely had better at places like OHSO.   My burger had a side salad with a vinaigrette dressing. I also ordered a mango rosemary martini. My husband ordered a beer and a strawberry chicken salad. Our bill was about 50 bucks. Overall, pricey. Decent food but if you have special requests like gluten free, don't expect too much effort.

photos.caption: Photo of FEZ - Phoenix, AZ, United States

OMlwm2IMLl1K6pWOMJ76uQ.text: We love this restaurant. We have been customers for many years, and, especially love it's new location. The food is first rate, especially the burgers. The have a full bar, large patio seating, and, a fun atmosphere. I especially love their "Blue Cobb" salad. They use butter lettuce, which is unusual and fab. We enjoy the wait-staff, who are friendly and fun. We certainly would recommend, they even have late night dining.

sL07NFkCGJrscxZDunj54g.text: The lover took me here for Valentine's day dinner. I've really been wanting to try this place.   I really loved the decor and the feel of the restaurant when you first walk in. For drinks, I ordered the white chocolate martini. OH MY GOSH! this was amazing! I ordered two and couldn't finish the second one but you definitely get your money's worth. It was so delicious. As for my entree, I ordered the bacon mushroom bistro steak. I wish there was more of the creamy mushroom sauce. And I ordered my steak medium, however I think it came out too rare. and it comes with A LOT of potatoes. lol.   I wasn't too fond of my entree, however I really liked my drink so I'd probably come back to try some more drinks. And the customer service was really good.

sA_LvdVzJrK91RcbBwtQOA.text: Enjoyed my experience at Fez! There's a cute atmosphere, and the server we had was really nice. It was kind of empty when we went, but I liked that! It was just late, needed some good food after a concert and this was one of the few nearby places that actually looked pretty good. I have heard amazing things about the veggie burger for years and I have to go back and try it. But yesterday I decided to just try out a couple of appetizers instead. We had such a hard time deciding because there were so many amazing vegetarian options. Also there's vegan options there too! We ended up getting the garlic hummus and nachos (with chicken on the side). The hummus was incredible. The veggies served with it were fresh and the bread was delicious and crunchy but I wish the bread was heated up a bit. The nachos were yummy too, I can be picky about nacho cheese but this was good stuff. Not like the best nachos ever, but tasty. The guac was yummy too, and my boyfriend said he liked the side of chicken. Prices weren't terrible for the huge portions we got. We had leftovers! That's rare for me.

photos.caption: Photo of FEZ - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Nachos and hummus

Vjzp42b4Ukd179msliB--g.text: I love FEZ, The food is always really good, the drinks are strong, I've never had to wait long for a table :)

Sx90dv8uUYJW2Of5-EBJEg.text: My friend and I met up at Fez for a causal lunch. I had been to their old location a few years ago & had really enjoyed it mostly because of the atmosphere. It was really relaxed and the food was good too. This visit, much like my previous visit, was pleasant.  For our meals, I got the Fez burger (with chicken instead of beef) & a side of fries and my friend got the Fez salad. The sandwich was a bit hard to eat because they're very generous with the sauce, and that paired with the pear & feta cheese is a bit sloppy but absolutely delicious. My friend said her salad was good too!  I'd definitely recommend trying the g-spot to drink. I'm not much of a grapefruit fan but per recommendation of our waitress I got it. It was super refreshing & delicious, especially for the summer time.  I will say that the service was absolutely terribly slow even though it wasn't busy at all! It took a while for our server to come by and get our drink/food order & then it really took way too long to get our checks. Since we had the afternoon to kill, we were ok spending a little bit more time there than anticipated, however.  I liked that there was a large parking structure right by the restaurant so having to look for parking wasn't an issue. I'd definitely recommend this place if you have time to spare. We'll be back in the future.

ZUIjalTgla-7rQDyQ2l2YA.text: What a nice change!  Everything was positive about my first experience here. Came for brunch/lunch on a Sunday, right at noon.   Busy! I sat at the bar and the young bartender promptly greeted me. Nice!  He gave me both the brunch and lunch menus.  Everything sounded delicious. I decided for a mimosa and the Spice Road (Asian) chicken sandwich.   Before I knew it, maybe 10ish minutes later, it had been delivered. Hot! After my first bite the bartender did the quality/satisfaction check. I loved it! Btw, the portion is quite generous. You will not walk out hungry.    My mimosa glass had one more sip left. The barback asked if I would like another. I did!  I took my time eating. Never did I feel rushed. Shortly after my last bite bartender asks if I needed anything else. I asked for the check and he quickly presented it.    Am I coming back? YES Do I recommend it? YES Service: 10 Food: 10 Atmosphere:10

38PnBzFHofUUh40wV_k3jw.text: I fell in love with FEZ years ago and have been away too long. It was great to revisit and find that the food is as good as ever. Although there are a ton of yummy sounding options on the menu, I always get the same thing because it is SO DELISH!  - Fez salad ($11.95) adding gyro meat ($4.95) on top. This is the kind of salad I dream of- a huge bowl of fresh greens, toasted almonds, goat cheese, dried cherries, and sliced pears. Although the menu says the pears are cinnamon spiced, I didn't notice it this time. The gyro meat is tender enough to cut with a fork and really tasty, not at all greasy or fatty. I prefer dressing on the side so I can control how much I add, and the one that comes with this salad is sweet and tangy.  - French fries- half cinnamon dusted sweet potato (these come with a yummy dipping sauce) and half garlic and rosemary. This basket is large enough for four people to share and only $4.25 during happy hour. - Happy hour specials on drinks are good, too, with a decent house wine for only $4.   Love this place and need to come here more often.

5am_SF0phPStdE_KVmbuAw.text: Looking for a variety of absolutely delicious food!? This is definitely the place to go!!

G567uS4avzS6r6MJK1ZnkQ.text: This is a super cute bar/restaurant within a few blocks of the Phoenix Art Museum. We walked there in less than 10 minutes.They have a dog friendly patio, a fun Middle Eastern themed menu (but with tons of American bistro options, too), and great happy hour deals. We had a cauliflower dip, spicy hummus, a brownie desert (I wish they had cupcakes) and drinks. I loved the cocktail with lavender water. Our server was the manager and was really great. The next time you are looking for a place for snacks and drinks after the musuem, check out Fez.

photos.caption: Photo of FEZ - Phoenix, AZ, United States

B7Qb2-Zcor1DmY3-aAbMeQ.text: FEZ has an open, spacious dinning area with well-kept outdoor patio seating but the food and service is lacking. Even though the restaurant was not full it took half an hour after our party arrived for us to order brunch, twenty minutes to get our food, and another half hour to get the check.  We ordered the FEZ jumbo hotcake with strawberry/blueberry, berbere prime beef hash & eggs, and golden curry egg scramble. The hotcake as advertised was one large pancake, but tasted more like a dense dry cake than an pancake; I only enjoyed the crispy crust. The prime beef hash was liked at everyone else at the table, but I did not like the excessive sauce and lack of potatoes. The golden curry was not outstanding either but the best of the three. I would return for the mimosa set for $15 but not the food.

y7Z3iAmTHBVRL_Bthe4srQ.text: Would go to Fez quite a bit before they relocated to current location.  My favorite are their burgers especially the Douxelle Burger which comes on a Ciabatta Bun with mushrooms, onions, swiss cheese, tomatoes and mustard. Everything about this combination works and is one of the top burgers in Phoenix.  Also had the rosemary fries which are excellent and served crisp.   The staff is always attentive and there to top off your drinks.  New location has a good size parking garage close to the restaurant if street parking is not available. One other option is the light rail has a stop very close to the front door.

FFxLYlQefeecvGhvObw79w.text: Their main Mexican fusion entree I had was disappointing as I heard their pizzas were too. But their appetizers and deserts are great. The place is always packed and the drinks seemed really good here. The ambience at night is perfect too.

JYq7dfnlDEp_Sjo0hWRa7g.text: Stopped in for dinner with 2 girl friends- we arrived just before happy hour ended.  Unfortunately the margarita is not fresh lime and served in a pint glass which is just so much gross fake neon mix.  For food I tried the lemon & Pomegranite grill plate with vegetables only.  This was served with "grilled" squash and onions with rice, pistachios and fresh Pomegranite seeds. Thank goodness for the slice of lemon & yummy Pom because otherwise this dish was a bore.   The tiramisu looked yummy but the other ladies were not a fan of it and so we did not try it. How can you not like tiramisu?  All I know is I did not want the whole thing to myself!  Our server was very timely, courteous and helpful.  He served all our food correctly and made a special inquiry to the kitchen as to if the goat cheese is pasteurized.  Maybe I tried the wrong dish and drink?  I say don't serve it if it's not fresh!  Next time I'm drinking wine and getting tiramisu for dessert!

a48TxmjXusfGkrzg4gTB8Q.text: Stopped in last week to waste some time and feed my boy child. Man I'm glad we did! I had the best burger ever!! Blue cheese & balsamic. Yum oh!  And cocktail selection was perfect for this warm weather.  I can't wait to bring my husband in.  Only downside was the acoustics of the place... Very loud conversations bouncing all over.

g4HaCdgZ8-gvT9MdnpNgTA.text: Never have I had a bad food experience at Fez until today.  My partner and I both had new menu items and both disappointed. I had the pom cran chicken salad.  The chicken cutlets were cooked to death and the salad was drowning in dressing. My partner had the battered cod which was one small piece of cod served with un memorable carbs.  Never should the food server be responsible for dealing with a bad experience.  I would have expected someone from the management team to come to the table and that did not happen.  I will go back as I have been a Fez patron for ten years.  I just expect more. As always the service is always delivered with a smile and enthusiasm.  Don't make these people do the dirty work you as management should do.  l

hfBlqjXKMyfklJXE7cCi_A.text: Second time I've been to Fez and it got even better. Brunch outside on a not-typically torrid Arizona Sunday morning was made better by two of the best cocktails: mimosa and bloody mary. Both WAY better than normal...bravo mixologist. Benedict and regular eggs...all done extremely well. And you can have a dog on the patio! I'll be back...you should go too.

_gWAoayiLRa26TOYScViyQ.text: Any burger is so yum here! With sweet potatoe fries that make me weak every time, yum!  My drinks are poored perfectly every time! Thank you!  Frequently visited the original location. Now that it's moved it's so much bigger you'd think it'd be the same no wait, walk right in FEZ! No, no mam. Had to wait half hour for a table. Never had to do that. Guess I'll call ahead next time. They do text you when your table is ready though.   I couldn't wait any longer, and there was no place for a my party of 4 to wait...  We were hungry and so we went to elsewhere  upsetting that there were a ton of empty tables as you can see the entire restaurant with the open windows and such. j8soKyg0wHCg7n15hKaNKA.text: This is my second time here. I ordered the crispy Florentine salmon, and it was severely under cooked. They tried to tell me that that was the way it should be, like tuna, but I did not believe them because my potatoes were also cold. Very uneven quality and I am not recommending this place.

ErMfXEC68AJlK3RqoVWUkQ.text: Stopped in at FEZ with a friend who recommended visiting the previous location. It was a great experience to remember.   The decorations and the ambiance was impressive at first glance. The open feeling and overall urban/loft vibe put me in a great mood and made me feel young again. The flowing feeling and overall walk through of the location made me very comfortable, despite being uneasy in a city I did not know or recognize.   The drink menu was beyond words. The type of drinks and choice mixes were some very interesting and curious blends. We had a delicious taste of a few, as we were a group of 4, so we each tried a sip of one another's. Each drink was unique in its own taste and was very delicious considering the way it was mixed and what the ingredients were.   The appetizers were very satisfying. We went to have some appetizers on our way out to the club, but it was very delicious and satisfying. A good option and choice meal to satisfy the palette.   I would recommend FEZ to anyone going to visit or anyone who hasn't tried it. Its a great experience.

S6rnLNiOHWXpXhcRLta58A.text: I was ready to write a scathing review, as I also was annoyed when they moved even farther from my neighborhood and my beloved turkey burger has been removed from the menu (a while ago I believe).  My friend and j waited for quite a while for a table, though they weren't that busy, especially in the bar.  Thankfully we could relax on the couch in the bar area and chat, so it wasn't bat big a deal.  I also don't get what's up with the "reserved" signed tables, and now understand why some restaurants don't take reservations.  However, beyond having to ask twice for a to-go box, the service once seated was excellent.  The food was also superb.  I had the $6 Wednesday special of chicken strips and salt & pepper fries, and it was amazing.  The serving size was generous, the food was served piping hot, and the presentation was even very nice for a glorified chicken basket!  Their thin strips of chicken breast were breaded with a subtly spicy, cinnamon-infused crunch.  The fries also tasted a bit more cinnamony than usual but they were probably fried with the chicken or just absorbed some of the chicken's aroma or something!  A shared slice of cheesecake was also really good, creamy and not too light or too heavy, with a light Nutella-like layer and a fresh slices strawberry to compliment it.  I grudgingly admit I'll be back, despite my annoyance with downtown in general.  I even found very convenient parking in the garage, so all I can complain about is the construction around the area and being stuck behind a bus.  Oh, I know a complaint I could make!  The seating was pretty awful.  I don't get why they would do half-booths where half of the party is stuck in a relatively uncomfortable chair!  Not a fan, and I miss the old familiar decor too...though my dining companion loved all of the colorful plastic/glass decorations like the giant thing above the bar.

BwP-F0MZJg6mbALm6K1LCg.text: Aww man.. why did you guys move? :( you were perfect down central.. I like the restaurant atmosphere, I don't know how I feel about it being a bar now. it's not the same.
