zK8x0gkuRSew-aoq8MPxfw.text: What I get when I come to FEZ: cumin cinnamon carrot soup + the veggie black bean burger which comes with a side salad.   Everything is exceptional right down to the dressing for the salad. My bill normally comes out to about $26 which is a little on the pricey side, but I am never disappointed. Whether it be dine-in, or take-out, FEZ is always consistent and always delicious.

_OqIunJYJlo7kK25jqxKJw.text: Greek Benedict was fantastic! Curry was ok. Cauliflower did good, but didn't realize was curry prior to ordering.

LYmgRmnShGDgdwDnLj_zng.text: It was listed as best burger Phoenix downtown. Can't say I was too impressed. The place has great service. The presentation is top notch. The Fez fries were good too. But the burgers themselves, the patty was blah, and the bun was kinda hard and difficult to chew. I thought I'd hit the jackpot when I read he menu cz all the ingredients looked insanely appetizing.

6WQ0KP8ZdzdR8koZ8Rti5w.text: I had breakfast here with a friend. Excellent food and service was fast and friendly. I was pleasantly surprised after hearing it was a "hipster" haunt.

UbCMrBHTp_fvarvsdctH3Q.text: FEZ is still the world championship belt holder for best burger in the world according to me.  The new location is nice, same great service and same great food.  It still gets crazy noisy during lunch time even with the new location with tiled ceiling.  Get the FEZ burger and sweet potato fries.

SBjxLc6O935M6crmaxbPnA.text: The same great, friendly service in a more open environment but yet still has space for private engagements. The bar area is by far my favorite change in that it's no longer segregated and even has additional seating around the parameter of the bar aside from right at the bar itself. The food is still the same great quality (if not a touch better) and the drinks are just as well made. The patio area is definitely better and larger and the garage parking is a nice perk as well (especially with the Blink charging stations for those driving eco-friendly cars.)   Overall, my doubts about the new space have all been put to rest as everything about this space is better and upgraded. Fez 2.0 reboot is a winner!

hZTPDow3W59TYxqAStwEvQ.text: Went in for lunch with a couple of friends today. I looked over the menu for quite some time and couldn't really decide on something because nothing really sounded great or appealing to me. I ended up having a burger without the bun as a "lettuce wrap". I really liked their old menu much better and I think $13 for a burger with blue cheese and a side salad is too much. I don't think I'll be back anytime soon if things don't change.

daMoOOk46LzQGNjXzgahtQ.text: We stopped by FEZ on Valentines night and were able to get a table after half an hour. We loved it.  The service was warm and accommodating without being over solicitous. I ordered the FEZ lettuce wraps and couldn't stop eating them. The balance of sweet, tart and crunchy was amazing - I will be trying to recreate it at home.  My husband had the spice road chicken sandwich with gluten free bread and it was delicious was well, and he loved the ricotta cheesecake.  We will go back when we are in Phoenix.

NPgfLIFdjlgFfgKLdIqaLQ.text: I was hoping for very good, but my experience was just good.  Service was solid, but the food was lacking.  Honestly it was pretty boring.  The curry was ok, but too sweet and too many veggies that were slightly undercooked.  The gyro platter was average.

y9E0-g7_PHomOMicFrpp0g.text: My sister and I tried this place and we didn't love it. The service was ok. Not great but not bad at all. Everything was just average.

HPCjLf2LBNyke2Q1c3iMIA.text: Must say that this place is pretty amazing.  Each time I travel to AZ I go out of my way to eat here. If you are not absolutely impressed by the food ( lamb sliders are amazing) You will completely enjoy the staff. The bartenders and servers treat you like you are the only table/person in the amazing restaurant.  The bartender Luke is extremely genuine, entertaining and attentive. He truly cares about his customers and this is obvious by the large group of regulars that welcome you at the bar and rave about him.  OVERALL definitely a place to frequent.

gHfu_B84md5ZpkOzmQwRKA.text: FEZ is just great. Great food, great service, great ambiance, great music. It is truly a great find. I was very impressed with the food. The burgers are great, and the chicken with rice is to die for (although very spicy). I highly recommend it.

0WV--RaJe6UJxt2PRcS_jQ.text: Four stars for ambiance, three stars for food, and about one to two stars on the service. Been here many times, mostly because the location is convenient and the food isn't bad. The sandwiches are a solid choice, good daily drink specials. I've had a couple entrees there and wasn't blown away. Last night, I ordered the arroz con pollo. It was super spicy, but not very flavorful. The rice was kind of gummy, in a thick, starchy red sauce more reminiscent of Chinese food than Spanish cuisine. After my food was brought out, a long period of time elapsed before anyone asked if everything was satisfactory, or would I like another drink, etc. And that's been consistent with past experiences there. Young and cute doesn't always equal competent and courteous, unfortunately. Not sure the point of a host/hostess stand when no one greets you upon arriving or leaving the establishment. I want to support the gay community here in Phoenix, and downtown businesses. But I'm more likely, at this point, to dine somewhere with consistently excellent food and service. There's too much competition for mediocre places to survive.

2LwpbHLHNnFx8RevVPVFOw.text: That's a generous two stars. My girlfriend and I sat outside on a beautiful Friday night, and that's where the trouble began. We waited an unusually long time to be served by Marissa, and then waited an unusually long time for our drinks and our fries. The fries were decent enough, they were the fries on the appetizer menu, and were topped with bacon, onion, feta cheese, ranch, and tomatoes. Sounds good, but I've had better at many dive bars around town, and have put together much better myself when I had the munchies. I don't even remember the cocktail I had, but my girlfriend got the daily special and she said it was weak and watery. I had the lamb sliders with mint yogurt sauce, cucumber, and tomato. Sounds good, but again very pedestrian. I left 2 of the four on my plate. My girlfriend had the black bean burger and was able to choke down about half. After the waitress brought our bill, I waited about 20 minutes then took the check up myself. The crappy service was tipped accordingly. Will never go back. Don't waste your time. There are many better bars and restaurants downtown.

7Nr7qBADTQGGxfF62OiHqg.text: I love Fez. I have always found the food to be excellent.  I really like the new location.  Seems bigger than the old location and has a cool atmosphere.  Only downside is that it can be somewhat noisy.  There is garage parking next to the restaurant that actually had a lot of spaces available when the restaurant was packed.  Overall, highly recommend this place!

XLvXyRUFR3yccYPVAQsoKw.text: Fez is just as good, if not better, after the move.  I love that they are closer to my neighborhood and right on the light rail line.  Every time I pass by this place is packed!  Great, modern atmosphere and vibe inside, friendly staff, and extensive menu with great food.  I enjoyed the gyro with fries last time I visited and loved it.  Fresh, flavorful and so tasty!  I can't wait to come back for martinis and more delicious food on that great menu!

tXmPz-Qmblui-9MPKxH5hw.text: I love this place (specially this new place on Portland Ave.) The food was same as always EXCELLENT! Although this time the service wasn't very good. I'm thinking FEZ got a new staff filled with new employees whom never been waiters before. I think a place like this should never hire inexperienced waiters. I mean, our waiter took forever to take our drink order THAT WAS A BAD START and from there he was late for everything.  He didn't do anything wrong, he just didn't have the experience to go in and out checking on us or other people (we were sitting outside..I don't want to think people who seat outside risk having a bad service). He didn't have that sense of urgency that we are all used to see at restaurants with these prices on the menu.  I was very disappointed and my fries got really cold and chewy just by waiting on more ketchup :/ I was really scared to ask for another glass of Stella.  I will still come back to this place because the burgers are to die for. I remember the name of the waiter but I won't say it here but he looks like he is a fan of The Cure If you know what I mean.

l0S6Iup0oh3TQFusOG1-og.text: I love the new space. 4 different seating options depending on group size and reason for dining. Food and drinks are still the best!

cRsyu0vXhkm1yh2liKRbyQ.text: Great happy hour! Very nice atmosphere and music.. Prices are unimaginable for the great quality of food and drinks. Ask for the bartender Sarah, great customer service. Let's not forget about the huge patio and great food... If you haven't tried FEZ then you haven't lived. Go live, go to fez!

sjtgBngANDatv_nQMLqKaA.text: I am so tempted to give this a one star but I know it would not be fair. While I would love to rate the food ordering process was impossible! They use a terrible delivery service that is not open during their operating hours. I tried getting a delivery two hours before the restaurant closed!! The experience is almost a bigger part of the restaurant than the food itself. They employ a cumbersome 3rd party website and at this point, after spending the last 30 minutes running in circles, I am just DONE. So disappointed.

8pNwfk6JR7a-fUGr7F6TQw.text: Not impressed. The service was slow and the restaurant was only slightly busy at noon - meaning there were empty tables. Finally asked for the the check and the order to go. About 10 minutes later ... Still waiting!!!  No check and no food.  The waitress seemed surprised that we had no check and brought that back and then came the food.  Salad was ok nothing earth shattering for $18. Eh. It's probably ok for the $4 martini Tuesday's and apps but I wouldn't get lunch there again.

iNRoN3-VFke1DLss3AEO_A.text: One of the best restaurants in Phoenix Arizona!!! Original menu with original delicious cuisines. The FEZ sandwich is a must try!

pHK-zEcJuVYOclE3x5hICQ.text: Went here for dinner tonight. The feta fries were great, the drinks were excellent and so were our entrees. The salmon on the salad was definitely fresh. Unfortunately I couldn't even describe the service as mediocre. When we wanted dessert, it took so long one of us just went to the hostess to ask her. When the server asked me if I wanted another drink, I had finished mine quite some time ago, and as good as it was, I wasn't about to spend that much longer there to enjoy the drink, so I declined. Of course the dessert was great, but the server had it on the receipt twice. I brought it to her attention, her only response was to tell me not to worry about it and she did not return with a corrected receipt. When I paid, she had not taken it off, and she was nowhere to be found again, so we ended up taking to the hostess again, as the manager was busy talking to another customer at the time. The hostess was apologetic, and when she had the server came up to correct the issue, her response was "I'm sorry, mistakes happen."  Service here has been an issue several times here for the two that were here for dinner with me. Two of us would have ordered another drink if it was not for the server neglecting our table and we would have likely ordered more than just one dessert to split also.

iYON91irUg81MiONVoJGJw.text: What a great place! Relaxing atmosphere, nice outdoor seating, and really great food. We had the tangier burger and the casablanca chicken sandwich with both the garlic/rosemary fries and the cinnamon sweet potato fries (my favorite part of the whole mean, lol). The sangria special tonight (huckleberry) was very good as well.

CfnJuHrCu2ApdAuuIdWLQg.text: Me and my boyfriend are new to Phoenix & so lucky to have found Fez! The service is great and the food is beyond amazing! Those sweet potato fries are better than anywhere else!!

k7wvaZE5SW5y0XlYKIRYVA.text: Sunday Brunch. $4 mimosas and the FEZ Benedict, add avocado. The hollandaise sauce was a little different than I expected, but delicious. The sun dried tomatoes were better than expected. The new environment is very nice, but but the seating isn't particularly comfortable. Overall, a great meal!

NRIu8dTS_0CIlW1HrVQyDg.text: great food and awesome happy hour and bar menu. great service but I took a star off because our recent visit we waited ten minutes at the table and nobody even bothered to stop by and say hello or take our drink order. we got up and left and a server said "have you guys been helped?" and I replied "no" and all we got was "awwh man!"  other than that, their food and servers are awesome. Brandon is the best!

NO_lc88Jf_RAuPK2D0ANbQ.text: My girlfriend and I went here the first time a few days ago for a late night meal. The service was excellent and the food was even better. I was very surprised at all the options they had and the drink special was awesome. Both of us were very impressed and it was reasonable priced for the quantity and quality of food that we were served.

qhgZ41IptLWHopyo1YKjJQ.text: Had a great lunch the other day! Strawberry sLad with grilled salmon added...great service at the bar and would come back when in town again. Fun decor and plenty of parking.
